quote: Thought is the original source of all wealth, all success, all material gain, all great discoveries and inventions, and of all achievement.
author: Claude M. Bristol

quote: Temporary success can be achieved in spite of lack of other fundamental qualities, but no advancements can be maintained without hard work.
author: William Feather

quote: Success makes men rigid and they tend to exalt stability over all the other virtues tired of the effort of willing they become fanatics about conservatism.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Success is a consequence and must not be a goal.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: We're not afraid of risking what was our success yesterday in order to explore some new field. We're adventurous. We like the challenge of unknown territory, unknown artistic field, and that's what stimulates us.
author: Guy Laliberte

quote: My proudest achievement has been the success of the shows and artists I have been involved with, because they were made in Britain.
author: Simon Cowell

quote: Success isn't always going to be a huge contract success is going to be if you just live out your purpose in life.
author: Allan Houston

quote: Awards are not the only markers of success I don't judge myself just based on them. I believe that each cinema-goer has his own mental trophies.
author: Fan Bingbing

quote: Well I think any author or musician is anxious to have legitimate sales of their products, partly so they're rewarded for their success, partly so they can go on and do new things.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly.
author: Cecil B. DeMille

quote: I have more love, success, and security than I could ever dream of.
author: George Michael

quote: Money does not guarantee success.
author: Jose Mourinho

quote: I'm not a defender of old or new football managers. I believe in good ones and bad ones, those that achieve success and those that don't.
author: Jose Mourinho

quote: It's the price of success: people start to think you're omnipotent.
author: Ben Bernanke

quote: We do not celebrate people who have made success out of serious hard work.
author: Iain Duncan Smith

quote: Hopefully I'll continue to have the success I've had.
author: Tiger Woods

quote: Well, certainly one of the ironies of the success of affirmative action is that the middle class within the black community no longer lives within 'black community' by and large.
author: Henry Louis Gates

quote: The historical basis for the gap between the black middle class and underclass shows that ending discrimination, by itself, would not eradicate black poverty and dysfunction. We also need intervention to promulgate a middle-class ethic of success among the poor, while expanding opportunities for economic betterment.
author: Henry Louis Gates

quote: It's not just the 'Grammys' that I've pulled out of. I also pulled out of the English awards as well. The reason that I wanted to pull out was because I believe very much that the music industry as a whole is mainly concerned with material success.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: The one thing that makes me feel super lucky about my financial success is that I have a housekeeper.
author: Gwen Stefani

quote: Commercial success still hasn't come to an artist that isn't signed to a record label. There are very few artists that can succeed without the help of a record label. The role of the record label is still required, it's still necessary.
author: Edgar Bronfman, Jr.

quote: Young people need the hands-on training that comes with a summer job. They need to know how to dress for success and nail job interviews. But most of all, they need mentorship, guidance, and inspiration.
author: Hilda Solis

quote: My career started young and I was really ambitious, and then I had success and I hung out with people who were much older. I think I might have been temporally misplaced, so I thought I was 40. It was a premature midlife crisis.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: So I feel like success is opportunity plus preparation, so work begets work, and as long as you're prepared it's going to continue to come your way.
author: Anthony Mackie

quote: I think that when we have a better educated society, when there is less violence in our cities, when people get back into the workforce and have the opportunity to take care of themselves and their families - that for me really is the kind of success and the kind of America that I think most of us still want, we aspire to.
author: Michael Nutter

quote: Entrepreneurs can't forecast accurately, because they are trying something fundamentally new. So they will often be laughably behind plan - and on the brink of success.
author: Eric Ries

quote: We crave instant success these days. If you are a really good sprinter and long jumper, you don't want to spend two or three years on a whole new set of events. You're used to doing well and it's difficult to give that up.
author: Daley Thompson

quote: Our worldly successes cannot be guaranteed, but our ability to achieve spiritual success is entirely up to us, thanks to the grace of God. The best advice I know is to give is to give those worldly things your best but never your all - reserve the ultimate hope for the only one who can grant it.
author: Mitt Romney

quote: Prospering just doesn't have to do with money.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: A constant struggle, a ceaseless battle to bring success from inhospitable surroundings, is the price of all great achievements.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Super-ambitious goals tend to be unifying and energizing to people but only if they believe there's a chance of success.
author: Peter Diamandis

quote: Success is the one unpardonable sin against our fellows.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Your success story is a bigger story than whatever you're trying to say on stage. Success makes life easier. It doesn't make living easier.
author: Bruce Springsteen

quote: In this world it is not what we take up, but what we give up, that makes us rich.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If you want to achieve things in life, you've just got to do them, and if you're talented and smart, you'll succeed.
author: Juliana Hatfield

quote: Not every difficult and dangerous thing is suitable for training, but only that which is conducive to success in achieving the object of our effort.
author: Epictetus

quote: I am highly offended by the total lack of acknowledgement of my contribution to Laker success.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

quote: I have no time for those who say there is no way Scotland could go it alone. I know first-hand the contribution Scotland and Scots make to Britain's success - so for me there's no question about whether Scotland could be an independent nation.
author: David Cameron

quote: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and eating only the top half of each slice.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: The common idea that success spoils people by making them vain, egotistic and self-complacent is erroneous; on the contrary it makes them, for the most part, humble, tolerant and kind.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Success is survival.
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: I feel like I want to take care of everyone and I also feel this terrible guilt if I am unable to. And I have felt this way ever since all this success started.
author: Jim Carrey

quote: A lot of people don't have near the amount of success as I've been blessed to have, and it's all about working hard and hoping that continues.
author: Luke Bryan

quote: As an actor there's a lot of scrutiny and, even when you've had success, it becomes about sustaining that success. A friend of mine described it as a peakless mountain. Even for De Niro there's Pacino and for Pacino there's De Niro.
author: Eddie Redmayne

quote: I'm extremely ambitious. I don't know why people are afraid to say that. I won't sell my soul to the devil, but I do want success and I don't think that's bad.
author: Jada Pinkett Smith

quote: I feel lucky because I was a nerd, which I talk about in the book, but I had academic success, so through that, because that's what my parents put a great deal of value on, I had a great childhood because I sort of fulfilled the expectations of being good at school.
author: Mindy Kaling

quote: I saw a lot of people have success handed to them that then exploited it. They didn't protect it or cherish it.
author: Aaron Paul

quote: Our success in Singapore was a Herculean effort by the whole team. Now I am determined to deliver on all we promised. I will be watching like a hawk.
author: Sebastian Coe

quote: From success you get a lot of things, but not that great inside thing that love brings you.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Success in the majority of circumstances depends on knowing how long it takes to succeed.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: At Princeton I gained a great deal of pleasure from success in my classes. knowing that I could accomplish those things, and I realized that my success was directly proportionate to the work I put in.
author: Brooke Shields

quote: Nothing succeeds like the appearance of success.
author: Christopher Lasch

quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: The manic pursuit of success cost me everything I could love: my wife, my three children, some friends I would have liked to grow old with.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

quote: Writers, as they gain success, feel like outsiders because writers don't come together in real groups.
author: Anne Rice

quote: All men's gains are the fruit of venturing.
author: Herodotus

quote: I always envisioned myself being a rapper and being in the game and having success, but you never know what it feels like or how you're going to be when you're there.
author: Wiz Khalifa

quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: It's our nature: Human beings like success but they hate successful people.
author: Carrot Top

quote: When it comes to social consequences, they've got all different people acting in different ways, very difficult to even have a proper criterion of success. So, it's a difficult task.
author: George Soros

quote: Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: Whatever success I may have attained is due to the fact that since I was old enough to work at all, my ambition has never deserted me.
author: Anna Held

quote: I would love to be a guest on a talk show or a panel that shows women who have been on reality shows who've had success, to prove to audiences that you don't have to be a fool to become successful.
author: NeNe Leakes

quote: You take all the things that frighten you, and when you can get them to work for you all of sudden people are calling you a success.
author: Randy Bachman

quote: If you can figure out my success on the screen, you're a better man than I.
author: Alan Ladd

quote: I'm used to adversity and working really well in difficult situations. It was hard for me to accept the success.
author: Paula Cole

quote: Though I had success in my research both when I was mad and when I was not, eventually I felt that my work would be better respected if I thought and acted like a 'normal' person.
author: John Forbes Nash, Jr.

quote: We fall forward to succeed.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: People fall forward to success.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: I don't think about financial success as the measurement of my success.
author: Christie Hefner

quote: Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
author: Jeff Rich

quote: Success is the space one occupies in the newspaper. Success is one day's insolence.
author: Elias Canetti

quote: Success doesn't mean that you are healthy, success doesn't mean that you're happy, success doesn't mean that you're rested. Success really doesn't mean that you look good, or feel good, or are good.
author: Victoria Principal

quote: That's the key to success, isn't it? It has to be fun.
author: Monica Seles

quote: I'm still craving approval from my parents. It took a lot of success for me to realize it was never coming. It's just not in their nature.
author: Andrew Stanton

quote: The success and the failure are not my concern, but His.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

quote: Choose something you like to do. I know it's a cliche, and you've heard it over and over. But the reason is, you're going to have to work long and hard to achieve any success. You better like it or life is going to be terrible.
author: Bill Kurtis

quote: People say we were an overnight success. It took us a year to be an overnight success.
author: James Daly

quote: You've achieved success in your field when you don't know whether what you're doing is work or play.
author: Warren Beatty

quote: People repeat behaviour that leads to flooding their brains with pleasurable chemicals. The short-term reward loop acts over hours to years, and the long-term reproductive success loop over generations.
author: Keith Henson

quote: Action leads to Attention. that in the short-term releases Rewarding brain chemicals and in the long term improves reproductive success.
author: Keith Henson

quote: I have gone from being a 21-year-old with wide eyes to a 24-year-old woman. With success comes a lot of responsibility and power.
author: Vanessa Carlton

quote: My success is not due to any personal superiority over other people.
author: John Philip Sousa

quote: Every day of my life I walk with the idea that I am black, no matter how successful I am. And our success is tempered by that; you're successful in this way given the fact you are black, and most blacks don't get to that point.
author: Danny Glover

quote: Instead of this confusion, we need the unifying force of an official language, English, which is the language of success in America.
author: Ernest Istook

quote: If people ask me for the ingredients of success, I say one is talent, two is stubbornness or determination, and third is sheer luck. You have to have two out of the three. Any two will probably do.
author: Fred Saberhagen

quote: Success isn't everything but it makes a man stand straight.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: I take great pride in all the tremendous success we've enjoyed at CBS. And the good news is that I feel even more enthusiastic about what my terrific team and I will accomplish going forward.
author: Leslie Moonves

quote: I am decidedly of the opinion that in very many instances we can trace such a necessary connexion, especially among birds, and often with more complete success than in the case which I have here attempted to explain.
author: Alfred Russel Wallace

quote: In a balanced organization, working towards a common objective, there is success.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: But the best teams I've encountered have one important thing in common: their team structure and processes cover a full range of distinct competencies necessary for success.
author: Jesse James Garrett

quote: I want to make sure I don't interfere with the success of that team next year. I don't see any way I could go to practice like most of 'em do, and not hurt the team. I'd go nuts if I tried doing that.
author: Bear Bryant

quote: It's harder to be a success, globally, and be artistic. Harder to have that balance than just to be artistic when nobody understands you.
author: Andre Benjamin

quote: The fame of heroes owes little to the extent of their conquests and all to the success of the tributes paid to them.
author: Jean Genet

quote: Success in almost any field depends more on energy and drive than it does on intelligence. This explains why we have so many stupid leaders.
author: Sloan Wilson

quote: My dad told me, 'It takes fifteen years to be an overnight success', and it took me seventeen and a half years.
author: Adrien Brody

quote: Rockefeller once explained the secret of success. 'Get up early, work late - and strike oil.'
author: Joey Adams

quote: Change can either challenge or threaten us. Your beliefs pave your way to success or block you.
author: Marsha Sinetar

quote: I am very optimistic, and I wish that God almighty grants me success to get a qualifying time. Only then can I go to the Olympics. If this happens I will be the first Palestinian athlete to gain a qualifying time. This will be a big achievement.
author: Nader al-Masri

quote: Integrity is so perishable in the summer months of success.
author: Vanessa Redgrave

quote: Success is not a place at which one arrives but rather the spirit with which one undertakes and continues the journey.
author: Alex Noble

quote: A strong passion for any object will ensure success, for the desire of the end will point out the means.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quote: Success is an absurd, erratic thing. She arrives when one least expects her and after she has come may depart again almost because of a whim.
author: Alice Foote MacDougall

quote: It's not enough that I should succeed - others should fail.
author: David Merrick

quote: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting that speaks.
author: Plutarch

quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: A poet is a nightingale, who sits in darkness and sings to cheer its own solitude with sweet sounds.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: As things are, and as fundamentally they must always be, poetry is not a career, but a mug's game. No honest poet can ever feel quite sure of the permanent value of what he has written: He may have wasted his time and messed up his life for nothing.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: There's a certain line between jokes and music and poetry that's a bit blurred in my mind.
author: Bo Burnham

quote: Immature poets imitate mature poets steal.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: You can find poetry in your everyday life, your memory, in what people say on the bus, in the news, or just what's in your heart.
author: Carol Ann Duffy

quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for the Creator, there is no poverty.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: From the beginnings of literature, poets and writers have based their narratives on crossing borders, on wandering, on exile, on encounters beyond the familiar. The stranger is an archetype in epic poetry, in novels. The tension between alienation and assimilation has always been a basic theme.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quote: When it comes to atoms, language can be used only as in poetry. The poet, too, is not nearly so concerned with describing facts as with creating images.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: Poetry, even when apparently most fantastic, is always a revolt against artifice, a revolt, in a sense, against actuality.
author: James Joyce

quote: Poetry and music are very good friends. Like mommies and daddies and strawberries and cream - they go together.
author: Nikki Giovanni

quote: Poetry is the lifeblood of rebellion, revolution, and the raising of consciousness.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I'm a great believer in poetry out of the classroom, in public places, on subways, trains, on cocktail napkins. I'd rather have my poems on the subway than around the seminar table at an MFA program.
author: Billy Collins

quote: Poetry is like a bird, it ignores all frontiers.
author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

quote: Writing a book of poetry is like dropping a rose petal down the Grand Canyon and waiting for the echo.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Poetry is the revelation of a feeling that the poet believes to be interior and personal which the reader recognizes as his own.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Poetry surrounds us everywhere, but putting it on paper is, alas, not so easy as looking at it.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: Cotton was a force of nature. There's a poetry to it, hoeing and growing cotton.
author: B. B. King

quote: Daydreaming is one of the key sources of poetry - a poem often starts as a daydream that finds its way into language - and walking seems to bring a different sort of alertness, an associative kind of thinking, a drifting state of mind.
author: Edward Hirsch

quote: Poetry is not a matter of feelings, it is a matter of language. It is language which creates feelings.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Hip-hop is about the brilliance of pavement poetry.
author: Michael Eric Dyson

quote: If you have so earth-creeping a mind that it cannot lift itself up to look to the sky of poetry... thus much curse I must send you, in the behalf of all poets, that while you live, you live in love, and never get favour for lacking skill of a sonnet; and, when you die, your memory die from the earth for want of an epitaph.
author: Philip Sidney

quote: Poetry should... should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry is language at its most distilled and most powerful.
author: Rita Dove

quote: We go to poetry, we go to literature in general, to be forwarded within ourselves.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Poetry is the one place where people can speak their original human mind. It is the outlet for people to say in public what is known in private.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Listen, real poetry doesn't say anything; it just ticks off the possibilities. Opens all doors. You can walk through any one that suits you.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: It may be said that poems are in one way like icebergs: only about a third of their bulk appears above the surface of the page.
author: Howard Nemerov

quote: A poet's work is to name the unnameable, to point at frauds, to take sides, start arguments, shape the world, and stop it going to sleep.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: Poetry is thoughts that breathe, and words that burn.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Poetry is emotion, passion, love, grief - everything that is human. It is not for zombies by zombies.
author: F. Sionil Jose

quote: America's liberal arts universities have long been safe zones for leftist thinking, protected ivory towers for the pseudo-elite who earn their livings writing papers nobody reads about gender roles in the poetry of Maya Angelou.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: I gave up on new poetry myself 30 years ago when most of it began to read like coded messages passing between lonely aliens in a hostile world.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Nobody, I think, ought to read poetry, or look at pictures or statues, who cannot find a great deal more in them than the poet or artist has actually expressed. Their highest merit is suggestiveness.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Poetry is the art of substantiating shadows, and of lending existence to nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: I know some people might think it odd - unworthy even - for me to have written a cookbook, but I make no apologies. The U.S. poet laureate Billy Collins thought I had demeaned myself by writing poetry for Hallmark Cards, but I am the people's poet so I write for the people.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: There are still many tribal cultures where poetry and song, there is just one word for them. There are other cultures with literacy where poetry and song are distinguished. But poetry always remembers that it has its origins in music.
author: Edward Hirsch

quote: I have not the slightest pretension to call my verses poetry I write now and then for no other purpose than to relieve depression or to improve my English.
author: Alfred Nobel

quote: Sri Lanka is an island that everyone loves at some level inside themselves. A very special island that travellers, from Sinbad to Marco Polo, dreamed about. A place where the contours of the land itself forms a kind of sinewy poetry.
author: Romesh Gunesekera

quote: If what distinguishes us from other species is speech, then poetry, which is the supreme linguistic operation, is our anthropological - indeed, genetic - goal.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: I cannot speak for more than an hour exclusively about poetry. At that point, life itself takes over again.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

quote: Spoken word poetry is the art of performance poetry. I tell people it involves creating poetry that doesn't just want to sit on paper, that something about it demands it be heard out loud or witnessed in person.
author: Sarah Kay

quote: Poetry is what we do to break bread with the dead.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Who writes poetry imbibes honey from the poisoned lips of life.
author: William Rose Benet

quote: He who draws noble delights from sentiments of poetry is a true poet, though he has never written a line in all his life.
author: George Sand

quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Paul Valery

quote: I have been enlightened. I have fallen into poetry and it has swallowed me up.
author: Keith Haring

quote: The drama is complete poetry. The ode and the epic contain it only in germ; it contains both of them in a state of high development, and epitomizes both.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I consider myself a poet first and a musician second. I live like a poet and I'll die like a poet.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Poetry is the opening and closing of a door, leaving those who look through to guess about what is seen during the moment.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: I have nothing to say, I am saying it, and that is poetry.
author: John Cage

quote: The poet may be used as a barometer, but let us not forget that he is also part of the weather.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: Breathe-in experience, breathe-out poetry.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: To read a poem is to hear it with our eyes to hear it is to see it with our ears.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Poetry is a mirror which makes beautiful that which is distorted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: God is the perfect poet.
author: Robert Browning

quote: One will never again look at a birch tree, after the Robert Frost poem, in exactly the same way.
author: Paul Muldoon

quote: I still read Donne, particularly his love poems.
author: Carol Ann Duffy

quote: As human beings, we are the only organisms that create for the sheer stupid pleasure of doing so. Whether it's laying out a garden, composing a new tune on the piano, writing a bit of poetry, manipulating a digital photo, redecorating a room, or inventing a new chili recipe - we are happiest when we are creating.
author: Gary Hamel

quote: The genesis of a poem for me is usually a cluster of words. The only good metaphor I can think of is a scientific one: dipping a thread into a supersaturated solution to induce crystal formation. I don't think I solve problems in my poetry I think I uncover the problems.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: I've written some poetry I don't understand myself.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Poetry is a sword of lightning, ever unsheathed, which consumes the scabbard that would contain it.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Drawing is a way of coming upon the connection between things, just like metaphor in poetry reconnects what has become separated.
author: John Berger

quote: Poetry begins where language starts: in the shadows and accidents of one person's life.
author: Eavan Boland

quote: I have been writing poetry for a long time now. I started writing in my school days.
author: Kapil Sibal

quote: The true spirit of delight, the exaltation, the sense of being more than Man, which is the touchstone of the highest excellence, is to be found in mathematics as surely as poetry.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Great poetry is always written by somebody straining to go beyond what he can do.
author: Stephen Spender

quote: Most people read poetry listening for echoes because the echoes are familiar to them. They wade through it the way a boy wades through water, feeling with his toes for the bottom: The echoes are the bottom.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Poetry should help, not only to refine the language of the time, but to prevent it from changing too rapidly.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The only thing that can save the world is the reclaiming of the awareness of the world. That's what poetry does.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Poetry is not an expression of the party line. It's that time of night, lying in bed, thinking what you really think, making the private world public, that's what the poet does.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: We make out of the quarrel with others, rhetoric, but of the quarrel with ourselves, poetry.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I don't think you get to good writing unless you expose yourself and your feelings. Deep songs don't come from the surface; they come from the deep down. The poetry and the songs that you are suppose to write, I believe are in your heart.
author: Judy Collins

quote: Theater and poetry were what helped people stay alive and want to go on living.
author: Vanessa Redgrave

quote: Poetry involves the mysteries of the irrational perceived through rational words.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: In poetry, you must love the words, the ideas and the images and rhythms with all your capacity to love anything at all.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: That's the way it is with poetry: When it is incomprehensible it seems profound, and when you understand it, it is only ridiculous.
author: Galway Kinnell

quote: Poetry is as precise a thing as geometry.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I'm sorry, man, but I've got magic. I've got poetry in my fingertips. Most of the time - and this includes naps - I'm an F-18, bro. And I will destroy you in the air. I will deploy my ordinance to the ground.
author: Charlie Sheen

quote: In the language of poetry, where every word is weighed, nothing is usual or normal. Not a single stone and not a single cloud above it. Not a single day and not a single night after it. And above all, not a single existence, not anyone's existence in this world.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

quote: You know, people speak in poetry all the time. They just don't realize it.
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: I don't think I've ever read poetry, ever.
author: Eminem

quote: I have piles of poetry books in the bathroom, on the stairs, everywhere. The only way to write poetry is to read it.
author: Carol Ann Duffy

quote: If you don't mark your successes, the day your ship comes in could be just another day at the office, and there's no poetry in that.
author: Glen Hansard

quote: It is certain that at certain times talent entirely overcomes thought or poetry.
author: John Singer Sargent

quote: If you've ever been to a poetry slam, you know that the highest scoring emotion is self-righteous indignation: how dare you judge me. So in that way, the poem, 'What Teachers Make,' is an absolutely formulaic slam poem designed to allow me to get up on my soap box and say, 'Let me tell you what really makes me angry.'
author: Taylor Mali

quote: When I rap, I get to express myself in a way where putting words together is like poetry, and sometimes it's better to talk in certain expressions than sing, you know? So I love, I love to rhyme when I want to express certain things.
author: Wyclef Jean

quote: I don't think I've ever read poetry, ever. I'm not really book-smart.
author: Eminem

quote: I think it's often assumed that the role of poetry is to comfort, but for me, poetry is the great unsettler. It questions the established order of the mind. It is radical, by which I don't mean that it is either leftwing or rightwing, but that it works at the roots of thinking.
author: Alice Oswald

quote: If poetry and the arts do anything, they can fortify your inner life, your inwardness.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Everybody interprets things differently with their own perception, and I want poetry to pull out of them their own feelings.
author: John Trudell

quote: Poetry, at its best, is the language your soul would speak if you could teach your soul to speak.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: I'm reading a lot of poetry because it's a lot easier to dip in and dip out when you've got 10 minutes to yourself.
author: Hozier

quote: Music has a poetry of its own, and that poetry is called melody.
author: Joshua Logan

quote: People wish to be poets more than they wish to write poetry, and that's a mistake. One should wish to celebrate more than one wishes to be celebrated.
author: Lucille Clifton

quote: If there's no money in poetry, neither is there poetry in money.
author: Robert Graves

quote: I guess I wanted to leave America for awhile. It wasn't that I wanted to become an expatriate, or just never come back, I needed some breathing room. I'd already been translating French poetry, I'd been to Paris once before and liked it very much, and so I just went.
author: Paul Auster

quote: The music just tends to be a vehicle for that poetry.
author: Mark Knopfler

quote: Literature is a state of culture, poetry is a state of grace, before and after culture.
author: Juan Ramon Jimenez

quote: I think the first time I really heard poetry was in the schoolyard. Just the little limericks that kids say when they're jumping rope and playing games. I think that's the first time I heard rhyming words - I don't know if I'd call that the definitive poetry, but that's when I heard rhyming words said and not necessarily sung.
author: Jill Scott

quote: What are the sources of poetry? Love and death and the paradox of love and death. All poetry from the beginning is about Eros and Thanatos. Those are the only subjects. And how Eros and Thanatos interweave.
author: Erica Jong

quote: More modern poetry is written than read.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Poetry at its best can do you a lot of harm.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Jazz and poetry both involve a structure that may be familiar and to some extent predictable. And then, you try to create as much surprise and spontaneity and feeling and variation while respecting that structure.
author: Robert Pinsky

quote: I was raised on songs of poetry like Simon and Garfunkel and Cat Stevens and Neil Young, etc. I love those old songs probably the most because they hit me so deep down in my core.
author: Jessica Steen

quote: When you write, it's just a much more crystalline, compressed version of the voice you think with - though not the one you speak with. I think your writing voice is your laser-guided missile. It's the poetry part of you.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: Maya Angelou was the voice of three generations. Her poetry spanned our journey, chronicled our hearts and documented our struggles as we moved from the orations of Martin Luther King to the presidency of Barack Obama.
author: Donna Brazile

quote: Poetry is the universal language which the heart holds with nature and itself. He who has a contempt for poetry, cannot have much respect for himself, or for anything else.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: In the television age, the key distinction is between the candidate who can speak poetry and the one who can only speak prose.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: I recently read that it's the left brain that does all that calculating, and the right brain that does the poetry. Somehow I've veered way towards the left. I've been doing it for years. Maybe I do art to balance it out.
author: Jason Mraz

quote: When I was 18, I took a trip to Thailand with a friend. We stayed for a month. Bangkok was very raw for a teenager: there were no cellphones, no Internet, and the only music I had with me was this cassette by Liz Phair. I was writing a lot of poetry, and she embodied a talky style of songwriting that I found very accessible.
author: Jenny Lewis

quote: In a way, Anglo-Saxon poetry cannot be translated.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: No poetry that I'm aware of, however bad or glorious, has ever left somebody a worse person than they were before they read it.
author: Felix Dennis

quote: What my character is or how many jails I have lounged in, or wards or walls or wassails, how many lonely-heart poetry readings I have dodged, is beside the point. A man's soul or lack of it will be evident with what he can carve upon a white sheet of paper.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: If the object of poetry is, to make men, then poetry is the heir of prophecy.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: Living here on Earth, we breathe the rhythms of a universe that extends infinitely above us. When resonant harmonies arise between this vast outer cosmos and the inner human cosmos, poetry is born.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: But I liked Yeats! That wild Irishman. I really loved his love of language, his flow. His chaotic ideas seemed to me just the right thing for a poet. Passion! He was always on the right side. He may be wrongheaded, but his heart was always on the right side. He wrote beautiful poetry.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: Alchemy is the art of far and near, and I think poetry is alchemy in that way. It's delightful to distort size, to see something that's tiny as though it were vast.
author: Robert Morgan

quote: Poetry is not only a set of words which are chosen to relate to each other it is something which goes much further than that to provide a glimpse of our vision of the world.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: Shakespeare was a man who wrote poetry. I'm a man who writes poetry. Why not compare yourself to the best?
author: Jay-Z

quote: Poetry fettered, fetters the human race. Nations are destroyed or flourish in proportion as their poetry, painting, and music are destroyed or flourish.
author: William Blake

quote: It is time to get drunk! So as not to be the martyred slaves of Time, get drunk; get drunk without stopping! On wine, on poetry, or on virtue, as you wish.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: I've written poetry since I was in the first grade, and it wasn't until I was a little bit older that I realized poetry could be put to music and become a song.
author: Jordin Sparks

quote: I am two fools, I know, for loving, and for saying so in whining poetry.
author: John Donne

quote: I saw the gooseflesh on my skin. I did not know what made it. I was not cold. Had a ghost passed over? No, it was the poetry.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: How can any one paint who cannot grade colors? How can any one write poetry who has not learnt to hear and see?
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Naming a baby is an act of poetry, for many people the only creative moment of their lives.
author: Richard Eyre

quote: All slang is metaphor, and all metaphor is poetry.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: In the total darkness, poetry is still there, and it is there for you.
author: Abbas Kiarostami

quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Everything one invents is true, you may be perfectly sure of that. Poetry is as precise as geometry.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Poetry should surprise by a fine excess and not by singularity, it should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: The reason why we do maths is because it's like poetry. It's about patterns, and that really turned me on. It made me feel that maths was in tune with the other things I liked doing.
author: Marcus du Sautoy

quote: Let's detox our cluttered academic brain. That's what the poet does. People call it daydreaming, detoxing our minds and taking care of that clutter. It's being able to let in call letters from the poetry universe.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: A poet must be a psychologist, but a secret one: he should know and feel the roots of phenomena but present only the phenomena themselves in full bloom or as they fade away.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: The poetry you read has been written for you, each of you - black, white, Hispanic, man, woman, gay, straight.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Poetry comes alive to me through recitation.
author: Natalie Merchant

quote: A theology should be like poetry, which takes us to the end of what words and thoughts can do.
author: Karen Armstrong

quote: Poetry carries its history within it, and it is oral in origin. Its transmission was oral.
author: James Fenton

quote: I am an artist, you understand? For me, a picture is like poetry. When you make art, this is not coming from an intellectual place. It's coming from the deep side of your unconscious, your soul.
author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

quote: Wanted: a needle swift enough to sew this poem into a blanket.
author: Charles Simic

quote: I do not see how a man can work on the frontiers of physics and write poetry at the same time. They are in opposition.
author: Paul Dirac

quote: The thing about great poetry is we have no defenses against it.
author: David Whyte

quote: I think the poetry that came out of Belfast, and especially the Queen's University set, in the 1970s and '80s - you know, Paul Muldoon and Seamus Heaney, Derek Mahon and Ciaran Carson - that was probably the finest body of work since the Gaelic renaissance, up there with the work of Yeats and Synge and Lady Gregory.
author: Adrian McKinty

quote: I'm not really a musician. I'm a performer, and I love rock n' roll. I've embraced rock n' roll because it encompasses all the things I'm interested in: poetry, revolution, sexuality, political activism - all of these things can be found in rock n' roll.
author: Patti Smith

quote: I wish our clever young poets would remember my homely definitions of prose and poetry; that is, prose = words in their best order; - poetry = the best words in the best order.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The poetry of a people comes from the deep recesses of the unconscious, the irrational and the collective body of our ancestral memories.
author: Margaret Walker

quote: Bleak House is just the most astounding piece of work. There's huge, visionary poetry in it.
author: Simon Callow

quote: Have you ever heard a good joke? If you've ever heard someone just right, with the right pacing, then you're already on the way to poetry. It's about using words in very precise ways and using gesture.
author: Rita Dove

quote: I love Sufism as I love beautiful poetry, but it is not the answer. Sufism is like a mirage in the desert. It says to you, come and sit, relax and enjoy yourself for a while.
author: Naguib Mahfouz

quote: Poetry is the record of the best and happiest moments of the happiest and best minds.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Written poetry is worth reading once, and then should be destroyed. Let the dead poets make way for others.
author: Antonin Artaud

quote: Poetry isn't a profession, it's a way of life. It's an empty basket; you put your life into it and make something out of that.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: It's not easy to define poetry.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: I don't like the word 'poetry,' and I don't like poetry readings, and I usually don't like poets. I would much prefer describing myself and what I do as: I'm kind of a curator, and I'm kind of a night-owl reporter.
author: Tom Waits

quote: I began writing early - very, very early... I was already writing short stories for the radio and selling poems to poetry and art festivals; I was involved in school plays; I wrote essays, so there was no definite moment when I said, 'Now I'm a writer.' I've always been a writer.
author: Wole Soyinka

quote: I've always written. There's a journal which I kept from about 9 years old. The man who gave it to me lived across the street from the store and kept it when my grandmother's papers were destroyed. I'd written some essays. I loved poetry, still do. But I really, really loved it then.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: For an American, there's no automatic place where people love the art of poetry. There's not a social class that considers poetry its property the way in some countries there's a snob value to the art.
author: Robert Pinsky

quote: If I have to make a self-portrait, I would put poetry and rebellion on the list. To be able to walk on a wire, to be able to juggle six hoops, you need focus, another word for tenacity, which is passion.
author: Philippe Petit

quote: The Victorian language of flowers began with the publication of 'Le Language des Fleurs,' written by Charlotte de Latour and printed in Paris in 1819. To create the book - which was a list of flowers and their meanings - de Latour gathered references to flower symbolism throughout poetry, ancient mythology, and even medicine.
author: Vanessa Diffenbaugh

quote: I have written some poetry and two prose books about baseball, but if I had been a rich man, I probably would not have written many of the magazine essays that I have had to do. But, needing to write magazine essays to support myself, I looked to things that I cared about and wanted to write about, and certainly baseball was one of them.
author: Donald Hall

quote: Poetry is one of the ancient arts, and it began as did all the fine arts, within the original wilderness of the earth.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: I came into music because I thought the presentation of poetry wasn't vibrant enough. So I merged improvised poetry with basic rock chords. That was my original mission.
author: Patti Smith

quote: Like most lit nerds, I'm a voracious reader. I never got enough poetry under my belt growing up but I do read it - some of my favorites, Gina Franco and Angela Shaw and Cornelius Eady and Kevin Young, remind me daily that unless the words sing and dance, what's the use of putting them down on paper.
author: Junot Diaz

quote: Each word bears its weight, so you have to read my poems quite slowly.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: Superstition is the poetry of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I started off in England and very few people knew I was Australian. I mean, the clues were in the poems, but they didn't read them very carefully, and so for years and years I was considered completely part of the English poetry scene.
author: Peter Porter

quote: The Bible is not just one book, but an entire library, with stories, songs, poetry, letters and history, as well as literature that might more obviously qualify as 'religious.'
author: John Drane

quote: Human beings love poetry. They don't even know it sometimes... whether they're the songs of Bono, or the songs of Justin Bieber... they're listening to poetry.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: If the poetry world celebrate its female stars at the true level of their productivity and influence, poetry would wind up being a largely female world, and the men would leave.
author: Eileen Myles

quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: 'Therefore' is a word the poet must not know.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Any healthy man can go without food for two days - but not without poetry.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Poetry is the art of creating imaginary gardens with real toads.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: A poet can survive everything but a misprint.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Poetry is ordinary language raised to the Nth power. Poetry is boned with ideas, nerved and blooded with emotions, all held together by the delicate, tough skin of words.
author: Paul Engle

quote: The crown of literature is poetry.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: A poet looks at the world the way a man looks at a woman.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: A poem might be defined as thinking about feelings - about human feelings and frailties.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: He could not die when trees were green, for he loved the time too well.
author: John Clare

quote: There may be more poetry than justice in poetic justice.
author: George Will

quote: There are men who can write poetry, and there are men who can read balance sheets. The men who can read balance sheets cannot write.
author: Henry R. Luce

quote: Poetry is all nouns and verbs.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: The blood jet is poetry and there is no stopping it.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: I think that the job of poetry, its political job, is to refresh the idea of justice, which is going dead in us all the time.
author: Robert Hass

quote: Poetry is a sort of homecoming.
author: Paul Celan

quote: I didn't want to deal in poetry. I got rid of that after a few months.
author: Tom Wesselmann

quote: Of course a poem is a two-way street. No poem is any good if it doesn't suggest to the reader things from his own mind and recollection that he will read into it, and will add to what the poet has suggested. But I do think poetry readings are very important.
author: James Laughlin

quote: Pound's translation of Chinese poetry was maybe the most important thing I read. Eliot a little bit later.
author: Robert Morgan

quote: A group of us started a community center in Santa Monica. We've tried different programs, and three have worked really well. A poetry group. Once a week we visit Venice High and talk to girls at risk.
author: Lisa Bonet

quote: Slowly poetry becomes visual because it paints images, but it is also musical: it unites two arts into one.
author: Eugenio Montale

quote: What we know is that Shakespeare wrote perhaps the most remarkable body of passionate love poetry in the English language to a young man.
author: Stephen Greenblatt

quote: So, poetry becomes a means for useful dialogue between people who are not only unknown, but mute to each other. It produces a dialogue among people that guards all of us against manipulation by our so-called leaders.
author: June Jordan

quote: Writing poetry makes you intensely conscious of how words sound, both aloud and inside the head of the reader. You learn the weight of words and how they sound to the ear.
author: Helen Dunmore

quote: I want a fever, in poetry: a fever, and tranquillity.
author: James Dickey

quote: Why should poetry have to make sense?
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: The poetry of this one is called philosophical, of that one philological, of a third rhetorical, and so on. Which is then the poetic poetry?
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Yet, it is true, poetry is delicious; the best prose is that which is most full of poetry.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The musician is perhaps the most modest of animals, but he is also the proudest. It is he who invented the sublime art of ruining poetry.
author: Erik Satie

quote: I see people who talk about America, and then undermine it by not paying attention to its soul, to its poetry. I see polarization, reductionism and superficiality.
author: Azar Nafisi

quote: I always wrote poetry and stuff like that, so putting songs together wasn't that spectacular.
author: Amy Winehouse

quote: When I hit a block, regardless of what I am writing, what the subject matter is, or what's going on in the plot, I go back and I read Pablo Neruda's poetry. I don't actually speak Spanish, so I read it translation. But I always go back to Neruda. I don't know why, but it calms me, calms my brain.
author: Tea Obreht

quote: The middle class is doing fine in fiction. But it's not what gets me going. I love the working class, and everyone from it I've met, and think they're incredibly witty, inventive - there's a lot of poetry there.
author: Martin Amis

quote: I read poetry to save time.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: The poetry and transgression that was so much of surrealism's anarchic force has been recruited into mainstream culture. It has been made commonplace by television and magazine merchandising, by computer games and Internet visuals, by film and MTV, by the fashion shoot.
author: Graham Joyce

quote: Modernism in other arts brought extreme difficulty. In poetry, the characteristic difficulty imported under the name of modernism was obscurity. But obscurity could just as easily be a quality of metrical as of free verse.
author: James Fenton

quote: Poetry, for me, is the answer to, 'How does one stay sane when private lives are being ransacked by public events?' It's something that hangs over your head all the time.
author: Lisel Mueller

quote: Poetry is my cheap means of transportation. By the end of the poem the reader should be in a different place from where he started. I would like him to be slightly disoriented at the end, like I drove him outside of town at night and dropped him off in a cornfield.
author: Billy Collins

quote: I think of something quite different from a snapshot. I know of a lot of poems, some very fine ones, that are like snapshots, but I'm more interested in poetry that is like an endless film, long stories, things that weave together many different strands, like a big piece of cloth, not like a photograph.
author: Robert Bringhurst

quote: As far as I am concerned, poetry is a statement concerning the human condition, composed in verse.
author: N. Scott Momaday

quote: My father loved poetry and music. But deep in himself he thought teaching the finest thing a person could do.
author: George Steiner

quote: One night, I lay awake for hours, just terrified. When the dawn finally came up - the comfortable blue sky, the familiar world returning - I could think of no other way to express my relief than through poetry. I made a decision there and then that it was what I wanted to do. Every time I pulled a wishbone, it was what I asked for.
author: Alice Oswald

quote: Poetry, fiction as novels or short stories - these are autonomous as created by their authors. They should stand on their own, like pieces of furniture that should be judged as to their usefulness, elegance.
author: F. Sionil Jose

quote: I am for poetry that is admired by peasant and aristocrat alike.
author: F. Sionil Jose

quote: For me, I used to be shy towards journalism because it wasn't poetry. And then I realized that the events that I covered in essays that became journalism were actually great because they inspired me, and they became my muse.
author: Alice Walker

quote: In Northern Ireland, helicopters are not usually used to promote poetry.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: I admire 'Adventure Time' for being a piece of art in the way that I think art should be. If you want to see it is poetry, you can, and if you don't, you can watch a fun cartoon.
author: Rebecca Sugar

quote: When I was young, I read everything I could lay my hands on, but the Scots in my storybooks spent their time fighting glorious battles, rowing across lochs, or escaping over moors of purple heather. Even those Scots were hard to find. For at school, we recited poetry according to the set texts the teachers taught us.
author: Theresa Breslin

quote: Surrealism is not a poetry but a poetics, and even more, and more decisively, a world vision.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Many great works of art, poetry, and music are inspired by astral memories. The desire to do noble, beautiful things here on Earth is also often a carryover of astral experiences between a person's earth lives.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: I owe my discovery of the Hot Club of Cowtown to Kinky Friedman, leader of the Texas Jewboys. When I saw that Bob Wills and his Texas Playboys were headlining the 2003 Santa Clarita Cowboy Poetry and Music Festival, I thought it my duty to check out the band that had inspired the Texas Jewboys.
author: Clive Sinclair

quote: I like cups of tea and reading books and poetry and old people things.
author: Bindi Irwin

quote: Poetry is a call to action, and it also is action.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: The muse, the beloved, and duende are three ways of thinking of what is the source of poetry, and all three seem to me different names or different ways to think about something that is not entirely reasonable, not entirely subject to the will, not entirely rational.
author: Edward Hirsch

quote: In poetry, I have, since very young, loved poetry in translation. The Chinese, the French, the Russians, Italians, Indians and early Celts: the formality of the translator's voice, their measured breath and anxiety moves me as it lingers over the original.
author: Fanny Howe

quote: There is a gap in my work from '84 to 2002, 18 years where I stopped writing. I was working at fiction and other things and starting a school and getting married and starting a family, but I wasn't writing poetry for the better part of 15 years.
author: Philip Schultz

quote: The major poets of New Jersey have all suffered, whether it's Whitman, who lost his job for 'Leaves of Grass,' or William Carlos Williams, who was called a communist, or Ginsberg, whose 'Howl' was prosecuted, or myself. If you practise poetry the way I think it needs to be done, you're going to put yourself in jeopardy.
author: Amiri Baraka

quote: I do believe that we've a responsibility to try to acknowledge the range, both geographic and graphic, of what's happening in poetry in English. I'm interested in poems that are first-rate. After that, I'm not too concerned if they come from Queens or Queensland.
author: Paul Muldoon

quote: When I get depressed, I try to get something for the terrible sadness that comes over me and create something in terms of poetry.
author: Spike Milligan

quote: The applause of his native land is the richest reward to which the patriot ever aspires. It is this for which 'he bears to live or dares to die.' It is the high incentive to those achievements which illustrate the page of history and give to poetry its brightest charm.
author: John Tyler

quote: The topics just kind of come to me. If they are relevant, it's because they're happening in the world around me, and it's affecting me. Poetry is my way of dealing with it.
author: Rupi Kaur

quote: There is no Frigate like a book to take us lands away nor any coursers like a page of prancing Poetry.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Money is a kind of poetry.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Music begins to atrophy when it departs too far from the dance... poetry begins to atrophy when it gets too far from music.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Hence poetry is something more philosophic and of graver import than history, since its statements are rather of the nature of universals, whereas those of history are singulars.
author: Aristotle

quote: The Bible should be taught, but emphatically not as reality. It is fiction, myth, poetry, anything but reality. As such it needs to be taught because it underlies so much of our literature and our culture.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: Every now and then I read a poem that does touch something in me, but I never turn to poetry for solace or pleasure in the way that I throw myself into prose.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Verse in itself does not constitute poetry. Verse is only an elegant vestment for a beautiful form. Poetry can express itself in prose, but it does so more perfectly under the grace and majesty of verse. It is poetry of soul that inspires noble sentiments and noble actions as well as noble writings.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I want to promote poetry to the point where you got all the baldhead kids running around doing poetry, getting the music out of the way and having only words, the spoken word, and then see what happens.
author: Russell Simmons

quote: Anybody serious about poetry knows how hard it is to achieve anything worthwhile in it.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Often people, when they're confronted with a poem, it's like someone who keep saying 'what is the meaning of this? What is the meaning of this?' And that dulls us to the other pleasures poetry offers.
author: Billy Collins

quote: Radio is such a perfect medium for the transmission of poetry, primarily because there just is the voice, there's no visual distraction.
author: Billy Collins

quote: I know my voice has a limited range of motion; I don't write dramatic monologues and pretend to be other people. But so far, my voice is broad enough to accommodate most of what I want to put into my poetry. I like my persona; I often wish I were him and not me.
author: Billy Collins

quote: Making poetry with a camera - that's the essence of what I do.
author: Denis Villeneuve

quote: Poetry must have something in it that is barbaric, vast and wild.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Stylized acting and direction is to realistic acting and direction as poetry is to prose.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: Instead of trying to come up and pontificate on what literature is, you need to talk with children, to teachers, and make sure they get poetry in the curriculum early.
author: Rita Dove

quote: The experience of poetry could bring my mother back to me. Poetry offers a different kind of solace - here on earth.
author: Natasha Trethewey

quote: I like to borrow forms and quotes and use a lot of allusions, in both poetry and music.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: Sunday is a likely day to write a poem. Because poetry is a piece of language flying around: you'll find notebooks, something on your phone. It's about finding them and getting them off that crumpled piece of paper and onto my computer.
author: Eileen Myles

quote: Poetry can tell us about what's going on in our lives - not only our personal but our social and political lives.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: For this reason poets and artists developed the doctrine of Art for Art's Sake. The community did not appear to need them, so, tit for tat, they did not need the community. This being granted, it was no longer necessary or even desirable to make one's poetry either intelligible or sympathetic to the community.
author: Louis MacNeice

quote: Good poets have written in order to describe something or to preach something - with their eye on the object or the end. The essence of the poetry does not lie in the thing described or in the message imparted but in the resulting concrete unity, the poem.
author: Louis MacNeice

quote: I liked to write from the time I was about 12 or 13. I loved to read. And since I only spoke to my brother, I would write down my thoughts. And I think I wrote some of the worst poetry west of the Rockies. But by the time I was in my 20s, I found myself writing little essays and more poetry - writing at writing.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I wrote some of the worst poetry west from the Mississippi River, but I wrote. And I finally sometimes got it right.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I find in my poetry and prose the rhythms and imagery of the best - I mean, when I'm at my best - of the good Southern black preachers. The lyricism of the spirituals and the directness of gospel songs and the mystery of blues are in my music or in my poetry and prose, or I missed everything.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I'm happy to be a writer - of prose, poetry, every kind of writing. Every person in the world who isn't a recluse, hermit or mute uses words. I know of no other art form that we always use.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I think that there is nothing, not even crime, more opposed to poetry, to philosophy, ay, to life itself than this incessant business.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: There's a love of rhetorical skill in the Muslim world. Osama bin Laden doesn't just go on tape cassettes and say, 'America sucks.' He recites poetry; he finds things that 'America sucks' rhymes with.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: It could be that all awful dictators are frustrated artists - Mao with his poetry and Mussolini with his monuments. Stalin was once a journalistic hack, and I can personally testify to how frustrated they are. Pol Pot left a very edgy photo collection behind. And Osama seems quite interested in video.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: I felt like my favorite writers have almost musical hooks in their work, whether it's poetry or a hook at the end of a chapter that makes you want to read the next one. And I think that my favorite writers definitely have something musical about what they do, in saying something so relatable and universal and so simple.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: Poetry and lyrics are very similar. Making words bounce off a page.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: We explore our environment, more than we are compelled to utter poetry, when we're toddlers. We start doing that later. Before that happens, every child is a scientist.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: When Auden said his poetry didn't save one Jew from the gas chamber, he'd said it all.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: Science arose from poetry... when times change the two can meet again on a higher level as friends.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: You don't have to be a renowned artist like Q-Tip to try your hand at poetry. You don't need any special equipment - that's the beauty of it.
author: Michelle Obama

quote: Poetry has done enough when it charms, but prose must also convince.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The Bible is very resonant. It has everything: creation, betrayal, lust, poetry, prophecy, sacrifice. All great things are in the Bible, and all great writers have drawn from it and more than people realise, whether Shakespeare, Herman Melville or Bob Dylan.
author: Patti Smith

quote: What I wanted to do in rock 'n roll was merge poetry with sonic scapes, and the two people who had contributed so much to that were Jimi Hendrix and Jim Morrison.
author: Patti Smith

quote: When I was younger, I felt it was my duty to wake people up. I thought poetry was asleep. I thought rock 'n' roll was asleep.
author: Patti Smith

quote: I didn't love Jim Morrison 'cause he was self-destructive. I loved him because of his work. Because of the way he merged poetry and rock-and-roll. Because he did something new.
author: Patti Smith

quote: Rhyme, that enslaved queen, that supreme charm of our poetry, that creator of our meter.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: In the French language, there is a great gulf between prose and poetry; in English, there is hardly any difference. It is a splendid privilege of the great literary languages Greek, Latin, and French that they possess a prose. English has not this privilege. There is no prose in English.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Writing criticism is to writing fiction and poetry as hugging the shore is to sailing in the open sea.
author: John Updike

quote: I must say, when I reread myself, it's the poetry I tend to look at. It's the most exciting to write, and it's over the quickest.
author: John Updike

quote: Art works because it appeals to certain faculties of the mind. Music depends on details of the auditory system, painting and sculpture on the visual system. Poetry and literature depend on language.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: The fact that Newark is having poetry festivals and peace conferences - all of these things are building an undeniable thesis that our city is making incredible strides forward.
author: Cory Booker

quote: On the subject of literary genres, I've always felt that my response to poetry is inadequate. I'd love to be the kind of person that drifts off into the garden with a slim volume of Elizabethan verse or a sheaf of haikus, but my passion is story.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: As an actor, there is room for a certain amount of creativity, but you're always ultimately going to be saying somebody else's words. I don't think I'd have the stamina, skill or ability to write a novel, but I'd love to write short stories and poetry, because those are my two passions.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

quote: I don't think I'd have the stamina, skill or ability to write a novel, but I'd love to write short stories and poetry, because those are my two passions.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

quote: On a practical level, poetry isn't something anybody has really made a great living at. I might sell some books and, once in a while, someone might pay to hear me read.
author: Viggo Mortensen

quote: Photography, painting or poetry - those are just extensions of me, how I perceive things; they are my way of communicating.
author: Viggo Mortensen

quote: I have a publishing company of books by me and books of others. It drew people to poetry readings and photo exhibitions and painting exhibitions that I've been doing for years before that.
author: Viggo Mortensen

quote: I've been reading poetry publicly for 20 years, and this is what you do - you express, you sometimes dig a bit to get a conversation started. That's the point of poetry. You're supposed to go, 'Hmmmm,' and 'Woooh!'
author: Jill Scott

quote: I was reading poetry to my girlfriends, and they were like, 'You're really good. You should go to some poetry readings or something.' And I eventually went and got a, you know, somewhat of a name for myself and a little bit of a following.
author: Jill Scott

quote: The claims I'm making for art are simply the claims that we naturally make around music or around poetry. We're much more relaxed around those art forms. We're willing to ask, 'How could this find a place in my heart?'
author: Alain de Botton

quote: Dylan captured what was on a million minds and turned it into poetry. With 'Blowin' in the Wind' or 'The Times They Are A-Changin',' he set a whole new standard.
author: Jimmy Iovine

quote: Existential philosophy, poetry and art - just like sadness - were all unavoidable to a tender young man in the meat works.
author: Michael Leunig

quote: When I am writing fiction, I believe I am much better organized, more methodical - one has to be when writing a novel. Writing poetry is a state of free float.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: I don't think of poetry as a 'rational' activity but as an aural one. My poems usually begin with words or phrases which appeal more because of their sound than their meaning, and the movement and phrasing of a poem are very important to me.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Americans have been tremendously fortunate in poetry, regarding both the quantity and quality of poetry produced. Unfortunately, it remains in schools and universities; it is not widely distributed.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Poetry is rather an approach to things, to life, than it is typographical production.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Poetry seems to be the only weapon able to beat language, using language's own means.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: To translate poetry, one has to possess some art, at the very least the art of stylistic re-embodiment.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: The more one reads poetry, the less tolerant one becomes of any sort of verbosity, be that in political or philosophical discourse, be that in history, social studies or the art of fiction.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: My idea is simply - is very simple - is that the books of poetry should be published in far greater volume and be distributed in far greater volume, in far more substantial manner. You can sell in supermarkets very cheaply. In paperbacks. You can sell in drugstores.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: This assumption that the blue collar crowd is not supposed to read it, or a farmer in his overalls is not to read poetry, seems to be dangerous if not tragic.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: I am a patriot, but I must say that English poetry is the richest in the world.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Poetry is not an art or a branch of art: it's something more.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Anyone who regards poetry as an entertainment, as a 'read,' commits an anthropological crime, in the first place against himself.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: American poetry to me is a sort of relentless, nonstop sermon on human autonomy.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Tyranny will make an entire population into readers of poetry.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: American poetry is this country's greatest patrimony. It takes a stranger to see some things clearly. This is one of them, and I am that stranger.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Poetry isn't just different from prose, it's more important for the human species.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: The charge frequently leveled against poetry - that it is difficult, obscure, hermetic and whatnot - indicates not the state of poetry but, frankly, the rung of the evolutionary ladder on which society is stuck.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: People who buy 'The National Enquirer' would buy poetry. They should be given a choice. I'm absolutely serious.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: People compose poetry, novels, sitcoms - for love.
author: Helen Fisher

quote: Being able to say something lyrically, to say something that will do more than just be words, is really hard. It's easy to do when you're writing a chapter of a book or writing poetry, but it's really hard to do when you're confined to a melody line.
author: Nikki Sixx

quote: That metre itself forms an essential part of all true poetry is a principle which not even the assertions of an Aristotle or the pronouncements of a Plato can disestablish.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: When you are writing literary writing, you are communicating something subtextual with emotions and poetry. The prose has to have a voice; it's not just typing. It takes a while to get that voice.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: I'm moved by people who see the world differently than others. People who see the world with a longing for its poetry often can be broken people.
author: Laura Dern

quote: For awhile after you quit Keats all other poetry seems to be only whistling or humming.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: What is beautiful enchants me. I mean not just physical beauty but a wider concept of beauty. There is beauty in poetry and in great musical or singing performances. There is beauty everywhere if you can just see it.
author: Andrea Bocelli

quote: Personally I always feel like I could use a little more of poetry apothegmatic power in my own work but we're always lacking something.
author: Junot Diaz

quote: I didn't start writing songs, honestly, until I started making my album. I was always doing poetry, but I never thought I could write songs. I discouraged myself and thought it was so hard. But starting this process and learning just what it is to be a songwriter and performer taught me that you don't have to feel discouraged about anything.
author: Alessia Cara

quote: In much of computer science, I can easily 'auto-grade' your work and give you an instant meaningful feedback. I can't do this when it comes to the subtlety of human thought, language, poetry, philosophy.
author: Sebastian Thrun

quote: I want to branch out. I want to write. I write poetry. I want to see my children grow up well.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Poetry is all that is worth remembering in life.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Shakespeare is rhythmic; he is musical in the sense that he likes poetry, and he's musical because he constantly refers to settings where there's singing and dancing.
author: Kenneth Branagh

quote: Maybe it is something to do with age, but I have become fonder of poetry than of prose.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quote: I love reading poetry, and yet, at this point, the thought of writing a poem, to me, is tantamount to figuring out a trigonometry question.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quote: It's just poetry, beauty and love. How hard can that be to act?
author: Robin Wright

quote: I certainly derived my skills as a prose writer from my scrutiny of poetry and of the individual word. But schools don't do things like that anymore - tracking words down to their roots.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: When the poet is in love, he is incapable of writing poetry on love. He has to write when he remembers that he was in love.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: I have felt great advances in my poetry, the main one being a growing victory over word nuances and a superfluity of adjectives.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Well, I still write poetry, but I wouldn't call myself a poet.
author: David Duchovny

quote: Well you can't teach the poetry, but you can teach the craft.
author: David Hockney

quote: I went through a phase of reading lots of Urdu poetry, thanks to the great transliterated versions that have become available.
author: Satya Nadella

quote: No poems can please for long or live that are written by water drinkers.
author: Horace

quote: The greatest thing a human soul ever does in this world... to see clearly is poetry, prophecy and religion all in one.
author: John Ruskin

quote: There's poetry in being the band that can sell out Wembley but also makes a record in a garage. I don't like doing what people expect me to do.
author: Dave Grohl

quote: I've read a lot of war writing, even World War I writing, the British war poetry of Wilfred Owen and Siegfried Sassoon, Robert Graves's memoir 'Goodbye to All That,' and a civilian memoir, 'Testament of Youth,' by Vera Brittain.
author: George Packer

quote: You pick up loads of baggage with your first record with reaction to it from fans and critics. So I went to Ireland by myself for a couple of weeks with my guitar. I read lots of poetry, I read Patti Smith's autobiography and started words and phrases and then songs started to take shape.
author: Ellie Goulding

quote: When I was in college, I really liked poetry. I don't read much anymore.
author: Steve Martin

quote: I want to write a play. I'd like to do an original musical. I should probably put together a poetry collection.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: We are supposed to write poetry to keep the gods alive.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: I think poetry is able to say things in such a small, perfect way that are so hard to say. I think it's a perfect medium for expressing difficult ideas and concepts and feelings. It's one of my great loves.
author: Jerry Hall

quote: I find a lot of poetry to be narcissistic.
author: Joni Mitchell

quote: Poetry consists in a rhyming dictionary and things seen.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Poetry has, in a way, been my bridge to my acting career.
author: Omari Hardwick

quote: I found poetry at 12 and 13 and, lo and behold, learned that my attorney father had a background in poetry - as he wore dashikis and Afros in the '70s and named his kids Arabic names. He was a poet and a lot like The Last Poets and Gil Scott-Heron and all of these folks. He definitely was an artist.
author: Omari Hardwick

quote: I was trying to pay the bills with poems, and it was easy to memorize my poems, because I'd be riding my bike in California trying to memorize them before going on stage at a poetry lounge.
author: Omari Hardwick

quote: That's the thing with me being a former athlete: in the way I attack characters and attack poetry is from the base of being an athlete.
author: Omari Hardwick

quote: Poetry is almost like my foundation for everything. I almost feel I am a better actor and writer because of it.
author: Omari Hardwick

quote: The fact of the matter is that the most unexpected and miraculous thing in my life was the arrival in it of poetry itself - as a vocation and an elevation almost.
author: Seamus Heaney
