quote: That is to say, epic poetry has been invented many times and independently; but, as the needs which prompted the invention have been broadly similar, so the invention itself has been.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

quote: Do-gooders are easily overlooked. We're supposed to be soft, touchy-feely types, who wear Birkenstocks, compost everything, and write poetry by candlelight.
author: Nancy Lublin

quote: The same people who are murdered slowly in the mechanized slaughterhouses of work are also arguing, singing, drinking, dancing, making love, holding the streets, picking up weapons and inventing a new poetry.
author: Raoul Vaneigem

quote: You don't have to suffer to be a poet adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Poetry lies its way to the truth.
author: John Ciardi

quote: I used to write sonnets and various things, and moved from there into writing prose, which, incidentally, is a lot more interesting than poetry, including the rhythms of prose.
author: Shelby Foote

quote: Poetry is the mother-tongue of the human race.
author: Johann Georg Hamann

quote: Even when poetry has a meaning, as it usually has, it may be inadvisable to draw it out... Perfect understanding will sometimes almost extinguish pleasure.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: If you read quickly to get through a poem to what it means, you have missed the body of the poem.
author: M. H. Abrams

quote: I think there are things in my story that have helped my creativity. Your father being killed, for instance, is one of the best things that could happen to a kid if he's going to write poetry or songs.
author: Roger Waters

quote: We all write poems it is simply that poets are the ones who write in words.
author: John Fowles

quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: No, what I should really like to do right now, in the full blaze of lights, before this illustrious assembly, is to shower every one of you with gifts, with flowers, with offerings of poetry - to be young once more, to ride on the crest of the wave.
author: Knut Hamsun

quote: Cut quarrels out of literature, and you will have very little history or drama or fiction or epic poetry left.
author: Robert Staughton Lynd

quote: I think that one possible definition of our modern culture is that it is one in which nine-tenths of our intellectuals can't read any poetry.
author: Randall Jarrell

quote: To a poet the mere making of a poem can seem to solve the problem of truth, but only a problem of art is solved in poetry.
author: Laura Riding

quote: The end of poetry is not to create a physical condition which shall give pleasure to the mind... The end of poetry is not an after-effect, not a pleasurable memory of itself, but an immediate, constant and even unpleasant insistence upon itself.
author: Laura Riding

quote: Well, I write a lot of poetry - that's where it usually all starts. I definitely want to show you guys sides of me - love, loss, heartbreak - all of that good stuff!
author: Tristan Wilds

quote: Each memorable verse of a true poet has two or three times the written content.
author: Alfred de Musset

quote: However, if a poem can be reduced to a prose sentence, there can't be much to it.
author: James Schuyler

quote: I used to joke that if acting didn't work out, poetry was my commonsense fallback.
author: Merritt Wever

quote: I wrote poetry, journals, and, especially, plays for the neighborhood kids to perform. I had an ordinary, happy childhood. Nothing much was going on, but I had fun.
author: Alex Flinn

quote: Society's dark hull drifts further and further away. It is this place - the place of our separation, our distinction - that much of his poetry occupies.
author: Tomas Transtromer

quote: I was kind of an outcast in school 'cause I always kept to myself and was writing poetry and then going on tour with my brother band all the time, so kids didn't know what to make of me.
author: Christina Perri

quote: And inasmuch as the bridge is a symbol of all such poetry as I am interested in writing it is my present fancy that a year from now I'll be more contented working in an office than ever before.
author: Hart Crane

quote: Painting (like poetry) chooses from universals what is most apposite. It brings together, in a single imaginary being, circumstances and characteristics which occur in nature in many different persons.
author: Francisco Goya

quote: The job of the poet is to render the world - to see it and report it without loss, without perversion. No poet ever talks about feelings. Only sentimental people do.
author: Mark Van Doren

quote: Reality only reveals itself when it is illuminated by a ray of poetry.
author: Georges Braque

quote: How do poems grow? They grow out of your life.
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: The poem is a little myth of man's capacity of making life meaningful. And in the end, the poem is not a thing we see-it is, rather, a light by which we may see-and what we see is life.
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: You don't make a poem with ideas, but with words.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: Freedom is poetry, taking liberties with words, breaking the rules of normal speech, violating common sense. Freedom is violence.
author: Norman O. Brown

quote: I intended an Ode, And it turned to a Sonnet.
author: Henry Austin Dobson

quote: A poem can have an impact, but you can't expect an audience to understand all the nuances.
author: Douglas Dunn

quote: I've always written poetry and lyrics. My first husband, who was a musician, we wrote a bunch of songs together.
author: P. J. Soles

quote: There is the view that poetry should improve your life. I think people confuse it with the Salvation Army.
author: John Ashbery

quote: Don't call my lyrics poetry. It's an insult to real poets.
author: Bernie Taupin

quote: I don't look on poetry as closed works. I feel they're going on all the time in my head and I occasionally snip off a length.
author: John Ashbery

quote: The mystic purchases a moment of exhilaration with a lifetime of confusion; and the confusion is infectious and destructive. It is confusing and destructive to try and explain anything in terms of anything else, poetry in terms of psychology.
author: Basil Bunting

quote: I've been surprised to learn how many people love poetry. It's beautiful to see that people want poetry in their lives.
author: Peleg Top

quote: It's always good to show that poetry isn't the little depressed lyric people believe it to be, that it's something bigger.
author: John Fuller

quote: In Bonn, where I studied for a year, I changed from classical to Romance philology, taught there by its great founder, F. Diez, and at the beginning of 1852, I received the doctorate for a dissertation on the refrain in Provencal poetry.
author: Paul Heyse

quote: Poetry is an orphan of silence. The words never quite equal the experience behind them.
author: Charles Simic

quote: Poetry is plucking at the heartstrings, and making music with them.
author: Dennis Gabor

quote: I wrote The Green Eye of the Little Yellow God in five hours, but I had it all planned out. It isn't poetry and it does not pretend to be, but it does what it sets out to do.
author: J. Milton Hayes

quote: I think of myself as an ambassador of the arts. In my heart of hearts, I know the world would be a more peaceful, tender place if we were more moved by the poetry around us.
author: Tim Seibles

quote: As a rule, men worry more about what they can't see than about what they can.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: It was pride that changed angels into devils it is humility that makes men as angels.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: The highest prize in a world of men is the most beautiful woman available on your arm and living there in her heart loyal to you.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow men. True nobility lies in being superior to your former self.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Wise men don't need advice. Fools won't take it.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Some men see things as they are, and ask why. I dream of things that never were, and ask why not.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: It takes a hero to be one of those men who goes into battle.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: A gentleman is simply a patient wolf.
author: Lana Turner

quote: It is not titles that honor men, but men that honor titles.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: A hero is born among a hundred, a wise man is found among a thousand, but an accomplished one might not be found even among a hundred thousand men.
author: Plato

quote: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity, for wise men say it is the wisest course.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: I believe in the brotherhood of all men, but I don't believe in wasting brotherhood on anyone who doesn't want to practice it with me. Brotherhood is a two-way street.
author: Malcolm X

quote: Feminism isn't about hating men. It's about challenging the absurd gender distinctions that boys and girls learn from childhood and carry into their adult lives.
author: Robert Webb

quote: Victory usually goes to the army who has better trained officers and men.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: No man has any natural authority over his fellow men.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: All men's miseries derive from not being able to sit in a quiet room alone.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Rules are for the obedience of fools and the guidance of wise men.
author: Harry Day

quote: Conservation is a state of harmony between men and land.
author: Aldo Leopold

quote: Watches are the only jewelry men can wear, unless you're Mr. T.
author: Gordon Bethune

quote: There are three kinds of men. The one that learns by reading. The few who learn by observation. The rest of them have to pee on the electric fence for themselves.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Passion is what gets you through the hardest times that might otherwise make strong men weak, or make you give up.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: Gold is good in its place; but loving, brave, patriotic men are better than gold.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: All men's souls are immortal, but the souls of the righteous are immortal and divine.
author: Socrates

quote: If any civilization is to survive, it is the morality of altruism that men have to reject.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: I think women are foolish to pretend they are equal to men they are far superior and always have been.
author: William Golding

quote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars, and they pass by themselves without wondering.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Those who profess to favor freedom, and yet depreciate agitation, are men who want crops without plowing up the ground.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: We must continue to prove to the world that we can provide a rising standard of living for all men without loss of civil rights or human dignity to any man.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Two men look out the same prison bars one sees mud and the other stars.
author: Beck

quote: It doesn't take a hero to order men into battle. It takes a hero to be one of those men who goes into battle.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: The hero is one who kindles a great light in the world, who sets up blazing torches in the dark streets of life for men to see by.
author: Felix Adler

quote: Men lose all the material things they leave behind them in this world, but they carry with them the reward of their charity and the alms they give. For these, they will receive from the Lord the reward and recompense they deserve.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: The Industrial Revolution has two phases: one material, the other social; one concerning the making of things, the other concerning the making of men.
author: Charles A. Beard

quote: It does not take a majority to prevail... but rather an irate, tireless minority, keen on setting brushfires of freedom in the minds of men.
author: Samuel Adams

quote: A lawyer with his briefcase can steal more than a hundred men with guns.
author: Mario Puzo

quote: Men often oppose a thing merely because they have had no agency in planning it, or because it may have been planned by those whom they dislike.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: The only use of an obstacle is to be overcome. All that an obstacle does with brave men is, not to frighten them, but to challenge them.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: These people are very unskilled in arms... with 50 men they could all be subjected and made to do all that one wished.
author: Christopher Columbus

quote: Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Timid men prefer the calm of despotism to the tempestuous sea of liberty.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The evil that men do lives after them the good is oft interred with their bones.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men rise from one ambition to another: first, they seek to secure themselves against attack, and then they attack others.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: It disturbs me no more to find men base, unjust, or selfish than to see apes mischievous, wolves savage, or the vulture ravenous.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: People who have no hold over their process of thinking are likely to be ruined by liberty of thought. If thought is immature, liberty of thought becomes a method of converting men into animals.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: I have often wondered how it is that every man loves himself more than all the rest of men, but yet sets less value on his own opinions of himself than on the opinions of others.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Here in America we are descended in blood and in spirit from revolutionists and rebels - men and women who dare to dissent from accepted doctrine. As their heirs, may we never confuse honest dissent with disloyal subversion.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Civilization is the progress toward a society of privacy. The savage's whole existence is public, ruled by the laws of his tribe. Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Yes, guns are to men what jewelry is to women!
author: Steve King

quote: All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Every creature is better alive than dead, men and moose and pine trees, and he who understands it aright will rather preserve its life than destroy it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Adversity makes men, and prosperity makes monsters.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must, like men, undergo the fatigue of supporting it.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: When the sword is once drawn, the passions of men observe no bounds of moderation.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: If we desire a society in which men are brothers, then we must act towards one another with brotherhood. If we can build such a society, then we would have achieved the ultimate goal of human freedom.
author: Bayard Rustin

quote: To sin by silence, when we should protest, Makes cowards out of men.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: In the past the man has been first in the future the system must be first... The first object of any good system must be that of developing first class men.
author: Frederick W. Taylor

quote: Associate with men of good quality if you esteem your own reputation for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

quote: Envy blinds men and makes it impossible for them to think clearly.
author: Malcolm X

quote: You will kill 10 of our men, and we will kill 1 of yours, and in the end it will be you who tire of it.
author: Ho Chi Minh

quote: I shall argue that strong men, conversely, know when to compromise and that all principles can be compromised to serve a greater principle.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
author: Buddha

quote: Let men see, let them know, a real man, who lives as he was meant to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Give to everyone who begs from you; and of him who takes away your goods do not ask them again. And as you wish that men would do to you, do so to them.
author: Jesus Christ

quote: Only free men can negotiate. A prisoner cannot enter into contracts.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Brave men do not gather by thousands to torture and murder a single individual, so gagged and bound he cannot make even feeble resistance or defense.
author: Ida B. Wells

quote: An American monkey, after getting drunk on brandy, would never touch it again, and thus is much wiser than most men.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: They talk like angels but they live like men.
author: St. Jerome

quote: The greatest enemy to human souls is the self-righteous spirit which makes men look to themselves for salvation.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: I am not a hero but the brave men who died deserved this honor.
author: Ira Hayes

quote: The superior man is distressed by the limitations of his ability he is not distressed by the fact that men do not recognize the ability that he has.
author: Confucius

quote: The true test of a man's style is the haircut. There are some men who look good no matter how their hair is styled, whether it's trendy or not. A man can change his haircut many times, but to pull off any haircut, you have to be very chic. Like Brad Pitt.
author: Carine Roitfeld

quote: All free men, wherever they may live, are citizens of Berlin. And therefore, as a free man, I take pride in the words 'Ich bin ein Berliner!'
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The child often sees only what he already knows. He projects the whole of his verbal thought into things. He sees mountains as built by men, rivers as dug out with spades, the sun and moon as following us on our walks.
author: Jean Piaget

quote: Men in general are quick to believe that which they wish to be true.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.
author: John Locke

quote: Men are so simple and so much inclined to obey immediate needs that a deceiver will never lack victims for his deceptions.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: We sleep safe in our beds because rough men stand ready in the night to visit violence on those who would do us harm.
author: George Orwell

quote: The vote is the most powerful instrument ever devised by man for breaking down injustice and destroying the terrible walls which imprison men because they are different from other men.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Some people think having large breasts makes a woman stupid. Actually, it's quite the opposite: a woman having large breasts makes men stupid.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: The less men think, the more they talk.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Landlords, like all other men, love to reap where they never sowed.
author: Karl Marx

quote: It does not take great men to do great things it only takes consecrated men.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: While civilization has been improving our houses, it has not equally improved the men who are to inhabit them. It has created palaces, but it was not so easy to create noblemen and kings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I am looking for a lot of men who have an infinite capacity to not know what can't be done.
author: Henry Ford

quote: There is no justice among men.
author: Nicholas II of Russia

quote: Make no little plans they have no magic to stir men's blood and probably themselves will not be realized.
author: Daniel Burnham

quote: The mountains, the forest, and the sea, render men savage; they develop the fierce, but yet do not destroy the human.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Men may be popular without being ambitious, but there is hardly an ambitious man who does not try to be popular.
author: Lord North

quote: A woman simply is, but a man must become.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: Video games are a waste of time for men with nothing else to do. Real brains don't do that.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Mark this well, you proud men of action! you are, after all, nothing but unconscious instruments of the men of thought.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men.
author: Herman Melville

quote: I like being a woman, even in a man's world. After all, men can't wear dresses, but we can wear the pants.
author: Whitney Houston

quote: Throughout the centuries there were men who took first steps, down new roads, armed with nothing but their own vision.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Men will bear many things from a kept mistress, which they would not bear from a wife.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: In Medford, I awaked the Captain of the Minute Men; & after that, I alarmed almost every house, till I got to Lexington.
author: Paul Revere

quote: With reasonable men, I will reason; with humane men I will plead; but to tyrants I will give no quarter, nor waste arguments where they will certainly be lost.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

quote: Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Manhood coerced into sensitivity is no manhood at all.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: Perfect numbers like perfect men are very rare.
author: Rene Descartes

quote: Under the pressure of the cares and sorrows of our mortal condition, men have at all times, and in all countries, called in some physical aid to their moral consolations - wine, beer, opium, brandy, or tobacco.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: It has always been a mystery to me how men can feel themselves honoured by the humiliation of their fellow beings.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: For evil to flourish, it only requires good men to do nothing.
author: Simon Wiesenthal

quote: School houses do not teach themselves - piles of brick and mortar and machinery do not send out men. It is the trained, living human soul, cultivated and strengthened by long study and thought, that breathes the real breath of life into boys and girls and makes them human, whether they be black or white, Greek, Russian or American.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: Violence and arms can never resolve the problems of men.
author: Pope John Paul II

quote: Strong beliefs win strong men, and then make them stronger.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Elegance is always in style for men. There are all different kinds of elegance. It can be silk, it can be a T-shirt.
author: Donatella Versace

quote: I directed the men in our barque to approach near the savages, and hold their arms in readiness to do their duty in case they notice any movement of these people against us.
author: Samuel de Champlain

quote: Every man needs two women: a quiet home-maker, and a thrilling nymph.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: Neutral men are the devil's allies.
author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin

quote: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Men take only their needs into consideration - never their abilities.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Even the handsomest men do not have the same momentary effect on the world as a truly beautiful woman does.
author: Jonathan Carroll

quote: Men's ideas are the most direct emanations of their material state.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Holy humility confounds pride and all the men of this world and all things that are in the world.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Content makes poor men rich discontent makes rich men poor.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: When we are really honest with ourselves we must admit our lives are all that really belong to us. So it is how we use our lives that determines the kind of men we are.
author: Cesar Chavez

quote: Pride, envy, avarice - these are the sparks have set on fire the hearts of all men.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Men should be either treated generously or destroyed, because they take revenge for slight injuries - for heavy ones they cannot.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: With fools, there is no companionship. Rather than to live with men who are selfish, vain, quarrelsome, and obstinate, let a man walk alone.
author: Buddha

quote: During a few days' halt near Vesontio for the provision of corn and other supplies, a panic arose from inquiries made by our troops and remarks uttered by Gauls and traders, who affirmed that the Germans were men of a mighty frame and an incredible valour and skill at arms.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
author: Epictetus

quote: Young men, hear an old man to whom old men hearkened when he was young.
author: Augustus

quote: Archaeology is the peeping Tom of the sciences. It is the sandbox of men who care not where they are going they merely want to know where everyone else has been.
author: Jim Bishop

quote: Black people can be the most conservative, the most discriminating. Especially among ourselves. It wasn't white people who said all black men have to wear baggy jeans.
author: Kanye West

quote: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
author: Camillo di Cavour

quote: Men of integrity, by their very existence, rekindle the belief that as a people we can live above the level of moral squalor. We need that belief; a cynical community is a corrupt community.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: For many men, the acquisition of wealth does not end their troubles, it only changes them.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Most men today cannot conceive of a freedom that does not involve somebody's slavery.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: The whole conviction of my life now rests upon the belief that loneliness, far from being a rare and curious phenomenon, peculiar to myself and to a few other solitary men, is the central and inevitable fact of human existence.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: Now the reason the enlightened prince and the wise general conquer the enemy whenever they move and their achievements surpass those of ordinary men is foreknowledge.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Live as brave men; and if fortune is adverse, front its blows with brave hearts.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: When men yield up the privilege of thinking, the last shadow of liberty quits the horizon.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: We all wish to live. We all seek a world in which men are freed of the burdens of ignorance, poverty, hunger and disease. And we shall all be hard-pressed to escape the deadly rain of nuclear fall-out should catastrophe overtake us.
author: Haile Selassie

quote: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I suppose I've always done my share of crying, especially when there's no other way to contain my feelings. I know that men ain't supposed to cry, but I think that's wrong. Crying's always been a way for me to get things out which are buried deep, deep down. When I sing, I often cry. Crying is feeling, and feeling is being human. Oh yes, I cry.
author: Ray Charles

quote: We shall suffer no attachment to literature, no taste for abstract discussion, no love of purely intellectual theories, to seduce us from our devotion to the cause of the oppressed, the down trodden, the insulted and injured masses of our fellow men.
author: George Ripley

quote: Sometimes the first duty of intelligent men is the restatement of the obvious.
author: George Orwell

quote: Men of genius are often dull and inert in society; as the blazing meteor, when it descends to earth, is only a stone.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Ah, lives of men! When prosperous they glitter - Like a fair picture; when misfortune comes - A wet sponge at one blow has blurred the painting.
author: Aeschylus

quote: I think men, growing up, you have to go through some form of hardship. You've got to harden the metal.
author: Ice T

quote: Bad men are full of repentance.
author: Aristotle

quote: When good people in any country cease their vigilance and struggle, then evil men prevail.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Men aren't necessities. They're luxuries.
author: Cher

quote: Of all religions, the Christian should of course inspire the most tolerance, but until now Christians have been the most intolerant of all men.
author: Voltaire

quote: You know that being an American is more than a matter of where your parents came from. It is a belief that all men are created free and equal and that everyone deserves an even break.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: As long as you know men are like children, you know everything!
author: Coco Chanel

quote: The intelligent ruler makes the law select men and makes no arbitrary appointment himself he makes the law measure merits and makes no arbitrary judgment himself.
author: Han Fei

quote: Children will always be afraid of the dark, and men with minds sensitive to hereditary impulse will always tremble at the thought of the hidden and fathomless worlds of strange life which may pulsate in the gulfs beyond the stars, or press hideously upon our own globe in unholy dimensions which only the dead and the moonstruck can glimpse.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: If a man has talent and can't use it, he's failed. If he uses only half of it, he has partly failed. If he uses the whole of it, he has succeeded, and won a satisfaction and triumph few men ever know.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: I shall never be a heretic; I may err in dispute, but I do not wish to decide anything finally; on the other hand, I am not bound by the opinions of men.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Men freely believe that which they desire.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: As a young boy, I was obsessed with endangered species and the extinct species that men killed off. Biology was the subject in school that I was incredibly passionate about.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

quote: The graveyards are full of indispensable men.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: A man is ethical only when life, as such, is sacred to him, that of plants and animals as that of his fellow men, and when he devotes himself helpfully to all life that is in need of help.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: There are only two kinds of men: the righteous who think they are sinners and the sinners who think they are righteous.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Men may die, but the fabrics of free institutions remains unshaken.
author: Chester A. Arthur

quote: How could man rejoice in victory and delight in the slaughter of men?
author: Lao Tzu

quote: When we tire of well-worn ways, we seek for new. This restless craving in the souls of men spurs them to climb, and to seek the mountain view.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: If we know that our own men are in a condition to attack, but are unaware that the enemy is not open to attack, we have gone only halfway towards victory.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: The proper study of Man is anything but Man; and the most improper job of any man, even saints (who at any rate were at least unwilling to take it on), is bossing other men. Not one in a million is fit for it, and least of all those who seek the opportunity.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: It is unbecoming for young men to utter maxims.
author: Aristotle

quote: Labor disgraces no man; unfortunately, you occasionally find men who disgrace labor.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: The 'morality of compromise' sounds contradictory. Compromise is usually a sign of weakness, or an admission of defeat. Strong men don't compromise, it is said, and principles should never be compromised.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: When men sow the wind it is rational to expect that they will reap the whirlwind.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Passion makes idiots of the cleverest men, and makes the biggest idiots clever.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Kings may be judges of the earth, but wise men are the judges of kings.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: This society is driven by neurotic speed and force accelerated by greed and frustration of not being able to live up to the image of men and woman we have created for ourselves the image has nothing to do with the reality of people.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Of all the properties which belong to honorable men, not one is so highly prized as that of character.
author: Henry Clay

quote: Ten men waiting for me at the door? Send one of them home, I'm tired.
author: Mae West

quote: Conservation means the wise use of the earth and its resources for the lasting good of men.
author: Gifford Pinchot

quote: At Athens, wise men propose, and fools dispose.
author: Alcuin

quote: Men are rather reasoning than reasonable animals, for the most part governed by the impulse of passion.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Men don't care what's on TV. They only care what else is on TV.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: I usually make up my mind about a man in ten seconds, and I very rarely change it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: We who lived in concentration camps can remember the men who walked through the huts comforting others, giving away their last piece of bread.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: Men ought either to be indulged or utterly destroyed, for if you merely offend them they take vengeance, but if you injure them greatly they are unable to retaliate, so that the injury done to a man ought to be such that vengeance cannot be feared.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Our defense is in the preservation of the spirit which prizes liberty as a heritage of all men, in all lands, everywhere. Destroy this spirit and you have planted the seeds of despotism around your own doors.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: You know when you're young and you see a play in high school, and the guys all have gray in their hair and they're trying to be old men and they have no idea what that's like? It's just that stupid the other way around.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: I don't like the clean-shaven boy with the necktie and the good job. I like desperate men, men with broken teeth and broken minds and broken ways. They interest me. They are full of surprises and explosions.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: A woman who is willing to be herself and pursue her own potential runs not so much the risk of loneliness, as the challenge of exposure to more interesting men - and people in general.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: Many men owe the grandeur of their lives to their tremendous difficulties.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: I am an agnostic I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Men must know their limitations.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: I never wanted to weigh more heavily on a man than a bird.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Luck is not something you can mention in the presence of self-made men.
author: E. B. White

quote: There is no such thing as justice in the abstract it is merely a compact between men.
author: Epicurus

quote: When a hundred men stand together, each of them loses his mind and gets another one.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Men are only as good as their technical development allows them to be.
author: George Orwell

quote: A bachelor is a guy who never made the same mistake once.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: I think men are afraid to be with a successful woman, because we are terribly strong, we know what we want and we are not fragile enough.
author: Shirley Bassey

quote: Commitment means that it is possible for a man to yield the nerve center of his consent to a purpose or cause, a movement or an ideal, which may be more important to him than whether he lives or dies.
author: Howard Thurman

quote: Men should strive to think much and know little.
author: Democritus

quote: Stronger by weakness, wiser men become.
author: Edmund Waller

quote: It's at the borders of pain and suffering that the men are separated from the boys.
author: Emil Zatopek

quote: Men are like the stars some generate their own light while others reflect the brilliance they receive.
author: Jose Marti

quote: A little nonsense now and then is relished by the wisest men.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: It is not materialism that is the chief curse of the world, as pastors teach, but idealism. Men get into trouble by taking their visions and hallucinations too seriously.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: As soon as the land of any country has all become private property, the landlords, like all other men, love to reap where they never sowed, and demand a rent even for its natural produce.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Strong men have sound ideas and the force to make these ideas effective.
author: Andrew Mellon

quote: I know now that there are men out there who are, for me, the whole package, who are supportive of my successes because they know I will be just as supportive of theirs. I'm less tolerant of foolishness now; I know that it's important I not tie myself up with the wrong person, because then I will miss the right person coming along.
author: Ginnifer Goodwin

quote: I'm basically different things to different people. If it's a guy, I'm-a probably have my guard up because it's a street rule that when men come around that I don't know, I just immediately throw shade on them. But I don't associate with fellas all that much; if it's a girl - a beautiful girl - I be nice.
author: The Notorious B.I.G.

quote: Solitary confinement is too terrible a punishment to inflict on any human being, no matter what his crime. Hardened criminals in the men's prisons, it is said, often beg for the lash instead.
author: Emmeline Pankhurst

quote: In consequence of inventing machines, men will be devoured by them.
author: Jules Verne

quote: Men become civilized, not in proportion to their willingness to believe, but in proportion to their readiness to doubt.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Men are strong so long as they represent a strong idea they become powerless when they oppose it.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: It is wrong to assume that men of immense wealth are always happy.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Much smoking kills live men and cures dead swine.
author: George Dennison Prentice

quote: If to do were as easy as to know what were good to do, chapels had been churches, and poor men's cottage princes' palaces.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The future may be made up of many factors but where it truly lies is in the hearts and minds of men. Your dedication should not be confined for your own gain, but unleashes your passion for our beloved country as well as for the integrity and humanity of mankind.
author: Li Ka-shing

quote: Men become wise just as they become rich, more by what they save than by what they receive.
author: Wilbur Wright

quote: The clever men at Oxford, know all that there is to be knowed. But they none of them know one half as much, as intelligent Mr. Toad.
author: Kenneth Grahame

quote: The more I see of men, the more I like dogs.
author: Clara Bow

quote: Sometimes a lot of us men think we are doing everything for the woman we love, but there is an aspect of a woman a man doesn't understand.
author: Shah Rukh Khan

quote: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
author: Confucius

quote: Not to engage in the pursuit of ideas is to live like ants instead of like men.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: Men think highly of those who rise rapidly in the world; whereas nothing rises quicker than dust, straw, and feathers.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is a natural aristocracy among men. The grounds of this are virtue and talents.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The superpowers often behave like two heavily armed blind men feeling their way around a room, each believing himself in mortal peril from the other, whom he assumes to have perfect vision.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Reasonable men adapt to the world around them unreasonable men make the world adapt to them. The world is changed by unreasonable men.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Men and girls, men and girls: Artificial swine and pearls.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: But men are men the best sometimes forget.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Regarding life, the wisest men of all ages have judged alike: it is worthless.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: None can love freedom heartily, but good men; the rest love not freedom, but licence.
author: John Milton

quote: Barking dogs occasionally bite, but laughing men hardly ever shoot.
author: Konrad Lorenz

quote: My dad's a beautiful man, but like a lot of Mexican men, or men in general, a lot of men have a problem with the balance of masculinity and femininity - intuition and compassion and tenderness - and get overboard with the macho thing. It took him a while to become more, I would say, conscious, evolved.
author: Carlos Santana

quote: I love to tease men with my legs.
author: Eartha Kitt

quote: When I got old enough to date, I realized that Valentine's Day is just a commercial marketing scam to make men feel bad. So I let my boyfriends off the hook.
author: Evangeline Lilly

quote: When I look up and see the sun shining on the patch of white clouds up in the blue, I begin to think how it would feel to be up somewhere above it winging swiftly thought the clear air, watching the earth below, and the men on it, no bigger than ants.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: Those who profess to favor freedom, and yet deprecate agitation, are men who want crops without plowing up the ground.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Scientists are not delinquents. Our work has changed the conditions in which men live, but the use made of these changes is the problem of governments, not of scientists.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: Some men say that they should be satisfied with the abolition of untouchability only, leaving the caste system alone. The aim of abolition of untouchability alone without trying to abolish the inequalities inherent in the caste system is a rather low aim.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Men don't pay attention to small things.
author: Katherine Johnson

quote: For my generation, the bomber jacket is like a replacement for the suit jacket. It's a piece that men wear every day, and it's something that I would wear for any occasion, whether it's on the street or going to an awards ceremony.
author: The Weeknd

quote: Millions of men have lived to fight, build palaces and boundaries, shape destinies and societies; but the compelling force of all times has been the force of originality and creation profoundly affecting the roots of human spirit.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: Brave men are all vertebrates they have their softness on the surface and their toughness in the middle.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I've come to accept that the life of a frontrunner is a hard one, that he will suffer more injuries than most men and that many of these injuries will not be accidental.
author: Pele

quote: Men who never get carried away should be.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: I know many married men, I even know a few happily married men, but I don't know one who wouldn't fall down the first open coal hole running after the first pretty girl who gave him a wink.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Some men storm imaginary Alps all their lives, and die in the foothills cursing difficulties which do not exist.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Who is to say that 5 men 10 years ago were right whereas 5 men looking the other direction today are wrong.
author: Harry A. Blackmun

quote: If there is a single quality that is shared by all great men, it is vanity.
author: Yousuf Karsh

quote: As a vessel is known by the sound, whether it be cracked or not; so men are proved, by their speeches, whether they be wise or foolish.
author: Demosthenes

quote: In Greece wise men speak and fools decide.
author: George Santayana

quote: Some men have thousands of reasons why they cannot do what they want to, when all they need is one reason why they can.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Kindly words do not enter so deeply into men as a reputation for kindness.
author: Mencius

quote: Man is not the creature of circumstances, circumstances are the creatures of men. We are free agents, and man is more powerful than matter.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I don't want to be a silly temptress. I cannot see any sense in getting dressed up and doing nothing but tempting men in pictures.
author: Greta Garbo

quote: There are two men inside the artist, the poet and the craftsman. One is born a poet. One becomes a craftsman.
author: Emile Zola

quote: On a group of theories one can found a school; but on a group of values one can found a culture, a civilization, a new way of living together among men.
author: Ignazio Silone

quote: All the problems of the world could be settled easily if men were only willing to think. The trouble is that men very often resort to all sorts of devices in order not to think, because thinking is such hard work.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: By nature, men love newfangledness.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: By burning Luther's books you may rid your bookshelves of him, but you will not rid men's minds of him.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: I dress for the image. Not for myself, not for the public, not for fashion, not for men.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Men are beasts and even beasts don't behave as they do.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Certainly the best works, and of greatest merit for the public, have proceeded from the unmarried, or childless men.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Law describes the way things would work if men were angels.
author: Christopher Dawson

quote: Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: If there existed no external means for dimming their consciences, one-half of the men would at once shoot themselves, because to live contrary to one's reason is a most intolerable state, and all men of our time are in such a state.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Justice consists in doing no injury to men decency in giving them no offense.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The truth is found when men are free to pursue it.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The integrity of men is to be measured by their conduct, not by their professions.
author: Junius

quote: You can talk about teamwork on a baseball team, but I'll tell you, it takes teamwork when you have 2,900 men stationed on the U.S.S. Alabama in the South Pacific.
author: Bob Feller

quote: As soon as laws are necessary for men, they are no longer fit for freedom.
author: Pythagoras

quote: If the whole of mankind is to be united into one brotherhood, all obstacles must be removed so that men, all over the surface of the globe, should be as children playing in a garden.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Men exist for the sake of one another.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: We know that we cannot live together without rules which tell us what is right and what is wrong, what is permitted and what is prohibited. We know that it is law which enables men to live together, that creates order out of chaos. We know that law is the glue that holds civilization together.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Many men fail because they do not see the importance of being kind and courteous to the men under them. Kindness to everybody always pays for itself. And, besides, it is a pleasure to be kind.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: Automation provides us with wondrous increases of production and information, but does it tell us what to do with the men the machines displace? Modern industry gives us the capacity for unparalleled wealth - but where is our capacity to make that wealth meaningful to the poor of every nation?
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Men do not shape destiny, Destiny produces the man for the hour.
author: Fidel Castro

quote: Honor is simply the morality of superior men.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: In the Muslim world, I had seen that men with white complexions were more genuinely brotherly than anyone else had ever been. That... was the start of a radical alteration in my whole outlook about 'white men.'
author: Malcolm X

quote: There's a lot of females that hustle, just like men hustle.
author: Fetty Wap

quote: If help and salvation are to come, they can only come from the children, for the children are the makers of men.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of men who have minded beyond reason the opinions of others.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Men of ill judgment ignore the good that lies within their hands, till they have lost it.
author: Sophocles

quote: Men are so simple and yield so readily to the desires of the moment that he who will trick will always find another who will suffer to be tricked.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: You have young men of color in many communities who are more likely to end up in jail or in the criminal justice system than they are in a good job or in college. And, you know, part of my job, that I can do, I think, without any potential conflicts, is to get at those root causes.
author: Barack Obama

quote: The world would be happier if men had the same capacity to be silent that they have to speak.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: The mother must socialize her daughter to become subordinate to men, and if her daughter challenges patriarchal norms, the mother is likely to defend the patriarchal structures against her own daughters.
author: Carol P. Christ

quote: Where all men think alike, no one thinks very much.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: The history of free men is never really written by chance but by choice their choice!
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Unjust attacks on public men do them more good than unmerited praise.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: Boxing is a lot of white men watching two black men beat each other up.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: I therefore claim to show, not how men think in myths, but how myths operate in men's minds without their being aware of the fact.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

quote: Men create the gods in their own image.
author: Xenophanes

quote: Men who are too good looking are never good in bed because they never had to be.
author: Sarah Jessica Parker

quote: Men blush less for their crimes than for their weaknesses and vanity.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: I don't think feminism, as I understand the definition, implies the rejection of maternal values, nurturing children, caring about the men in your life. That is just nonsense to me.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: There is a solid satisfaction in one's having and being conscious that he merits the good opinion of men of true discernment and real worth. But to have a name among the weak and the wicked is shame and reproach.
author: Samuel Adams

quote: Fishes live in the sea, as men do on land: the great ones eat up the little ones.
author: Pericles

quote: My native land is a slave of heathenism, men's god is their belly, and they live only for the present. The richer a man, the holier.
author: St. Jerome

quote: I only like two kinds of men, domestic and imported.
author: Mae West

quote: We cannot be kind to each other here for even an hour. We whisper, and hint, and chuckle and grin at our brother's shame; however you take it we men are a little breed.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: I believe in work, hard work, and long hours of work. Men do not breakdown from overwork, but from worry and dissipation.
author: Charles Evans Hughes

quote: It is not reasonable that those who gamble with men's lives should not pay with their own.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: When my young men began the killing, my heart was hurt.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: You talk about American technocracy and you find men on the moon, not once, but several times... and safely home again.
author: Gordon Sinclair

quote: Men always do leave off really thinking, when the last bit of wild animal dies in them.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Some men do think I'm a psycho bunny-boiler.
author: Amy Winehouse

quote: I can paint pictures, but I cannot rule men.
author: Fra Angelico

quote: Most men are within a finger's breadth of being mad.
author: Diogenes

quote: The world owes all its onward impulses to men ill at ease. The happy man inevitably confines himself within ancient limits.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Many years ago, I concluded that a few hair shirts were part of the mental wardrobe of every man. The president differs from other men in that he has a more extensive wardrobe.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: I am fed up with men who use sex like a sleeping pill.
author: Toni Braxton

quote: It will be of little avail to the people that the laws are made by men of their own choice if the laws be so voluminous that they cannot be read, or so incoherent that they cannot be understood.
author: James Madison

quote: The men who abandon themselves to the passions of this miserable life, are compared in Scripture to beasts.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Deliberation is the work of many men. Action, of one alone.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: If the world were a logical place, men would ride side saddle.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Every actual State is corrupt. Good men must not obey laws too well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The public weal requires that men should betray, and lie, and massacre.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: That all men are equal is a proposition to which, at ordinary times, no sane human being has ever given his assent.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Like all weak men he laid an exaggerated stress on not changing one's mind.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: All those men have their price.
author: Robert Walpole

quote: What, but the rapacity of the only men who exercised their reason, the priests, secured such vast property to the church, when a man gave his perishable substance to save himself from the dark torments of purgatory.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: It's almost like a lot of black people in America, a lot of young black men, are born with this cloud over their heads. It's their penitentiary cloud, this philosophy we all have, that it's harder for us.
author: Erykah Badu

quote: The great and unlooked for discoveries that have taken place of late years have all concurred to lead many men into the opinion that we were touching on a period big with the most important changes.
author: Thomas Malthus

quote: The fears of one class of men are not the measure of the rights of another.
author: George Bancroft

quote: Reflection makes men cowards.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The fact is, when men carry the same ideals in their hearts, nothing can isolate them - neither prison walls nor the sod of cemeteries. For a single memory, a single spirit, a single idea, a single conscience, a single dignity will sustain them all.
author: Fidel Castro

quote: I do not consider it an insult, but rather a compliment to be called an agnostic. I do not pretend to know where many ignorant men are sure - that is all that agnosticism means.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Love rules the court, the camp, the grove, And men below, and saints above: For love is heaven, and heaven is love.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Ignorant people see life as either existence or non-existence, but wise men see it beyond both existence and non-existence to something that transcends them both; this is an observation of the Middle Way.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Men stumble over pebbles, never over mountains.
author: Marilyn French

quote: You can employ men and hire hands to work for you, but you must win their hearts to have them work with you.
author: Merle Shain

quote: Men should be like Kleenex, soft, strong and disposable.
author: Cher

quote: Too often I would hear men boast of the miles covered that day, rarely of what they had seen.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Be thou incapable of change in that which is right, and men will rely upon thee. Establish unto thyself principles of action; and see that thou ever act according to them. First know that thy principles are just, and then be thou.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Nothing is as peevish and pedantic as men's judgments of one another.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: By indignities men come to dignities.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Circumstances rule men men do not rule circumstances.
author: Herodotus

quote: Men are not punished for their sins, but by them.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Most men, when they think they are thinking, are merely rearranging their prejudices.
author: Knute Rockne

quote: Men do not quit playing because they grow old they grow old because they quit playing.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Men are like sheep, of which a flock is more easily driven than a single one.
author: Richard Whately

quote: Men do not fail they give up trying.
author: Elihu Root

quote: Men often act knowingly against their interest.
author: David Hume

quote: Men, who are rogues individually, are in the mass very honorable people.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: Men won't read any email from a woman that's over 200 words long.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He says 'I was beaten', he does not say 'My men were beaten.'
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: What's with you men? Would hair stop growing on your chest if you asked directions somewhere?
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: A great value of antiquity lies in the fact that its writings are the only ones that modern men still read with exactness.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: In department stores, so much kitchen equipment is bought indiscriminately by people who just come in for men's underwear.
author: Julia Child

quote: When men are full of envy they disparage everything, whether it be good or bad.
author: Tacitus

quote: Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.
author: Herodotus

quote: What distinguishes the majority of men from the few is their inability to act according to their beliefs.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Those who excel in virtue have the best right of all to rebel, but then they are of all men the least inclined to do so.
author: Aristotle

quote: I don't think there are any men who are faithful to their wives.
author: Jackie Kennedy

quote: Diamonds never leave you... men do!
author: Shirley Bassey

quote: More men fail through lack of purpose than lack of talent.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: Once men are caught up in an event, they cease to be afraid. Only the unknown frightens men.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: If you would convince a man that he does wrong, do right. Men will believe what they see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Nine men in ten are would be suicides.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Women love us for our defects. If we have enough of them, they will forgive us everything, even our gigantic intellects.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Men give away nothing so liberally as their advice.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Women prefer to talk in twos, while men prefer to talk in threes.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I only have 'yes' men around me. Who needs 'no' men?
author: Mae West

quote: Men are freest when they are most unconscious of freedom. The shout is a rattling of chains, always was.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: In life we shall find many men that are great, and some that are good, but very few men that are both great and good.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Men's arguments often prove nothing but their wishes.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The country is filled with energetic and enterprising men, rendered desperate by being reduced from affluence to poverty through the vicissitudes of the times. They will give an impulse to smuggling unknown to the country heretofore.
author: John C. Calhoun

quote: On this shrunken globe, men can no longer live as strangers.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: One must judge men not by their opinions, but by what their opinions have made of them.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Whatever crushes individuality is despotism, by whatever name it may be called and whether it professes to be enforcing the will of God or the injunctions of men.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Men tend to feel threatened women tend to feel guilty.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: What is the most beautiful in virile men is something feminine what is most beautiful in feminine women is something masculine.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Boys will be boys, and so will a lot of middle-aged men.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: All men were made by the Great Spirit Chief. They are all brothers.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: There is always a type of man who says he loves his fellow men, and expects to make a living at it.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Men have as exaggerated an idea of their rights as women have of their wrongs.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Lonely women destroy themselves lonely men threaten the world.
author: Victor LaValle

quote: It is only the great men who are truly obscene. If they had not dared to be obscene, they could never have dared to be great.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: It is easier to lead men to combat, stirring up their passion, than to restrain them and direct them toward the patient labors of peace.
author: Andre Gide

quote: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Life, in my estimation, is a biological misadventure that we terminate on the shoulders of six strange men whose only objective is to make a hole in one with you.
author: Fred Allen

quote: Whatever makes men good Christians, makes them good citizens.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Men may live fools, but fools they cannot die.
author: Edward Young

quote: Men, even when alone, lighten their labors by song, however rude it may be.
author: Quintilian

quote: Men tire themselves in pursuit of rest.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Homosexuality in Russia is a crime and the punishment is seven years in prison, locked up with the other men. There is a three year waiting list.
author: Yakov Smirnoff

quote: Every man is a volume if you know how to read him.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Men are actually the weaker sex.
author: George Weinberg

quote: A lot of times, women don't get the male perspective in regards to a relationship, what men go through when they're not really dealing well.
author: Morris Chestnut

quote: Italian men do appreciate beautiful women. They're not afraid of the beauty, which is nice.
author: Eva Herzigova

quote: All men have an instinct for conflict: at least, all healthy men.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Women thrive on novelty and are easy meat for the commerce of fashion. Men prefer old pipes and torn jackets.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Culture makes all men gentle.
author: Menander

quote: Like all young men I set out to be a genius, but mercifully laughter intervened.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: First find the man in yourself if you will inspire manliness in others.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: There will always be men struggling to change, and there will always be those who are controlled by the past.
author: Ernest Gaines

quote: For most men life is a search for the proper manila envelope in which to get themselves filed.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Whenever ideas fail, men invent words.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quote: Every time a man expects, as he says, his money to work for him, he is expecting other people to work for him.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Either men will learn to live like brothers, or they will die like beasts.
author: Max Lerner

quote: A dress makes no sense unless it inspires men to take it off of you.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Men are different. When they are in love they may also have other girlfriends.
author: Zhang Ziyi

quote: No nice men are good at getting taxis.
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: He was one of those men who possess almost every gift, except the gift of the power to use them.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Men are not against you they are merely for themselves.
author: Gene Fowler

quote: What do women do when they get together? We sit around and talk! Men, not so much. My theory is that this difference is genetic and dates back to the hunter-gatherer societies, when the men had to be quiet as they hunted, lest they scare away the bison and then everyone starved to death and it was all their fault.
author: Jenna McCarthy

quote: The beauty of a strong, lasting commitment is often best understood by men incapable of it.
author: Murray Kempton

quote: When a man is no longer anxious to do better than well, he is done for.
author: Benjamin Haydon

quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
author: Buddha

quote: While seeking revenge, dig two graves - one for yourself.
author: Douglas Horton

quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Confucius

quote: Anger is the enemy of non-violence and pride is a monster that swallows it up.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else you are the one who gets burned.
author: Buddha

quote: I don't usually lose my temper, but if I get angry, it's true - I'm scary.
author: Eva Mendes

quote: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems - not people to focus your energies on answers - not excuses.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.
author: Josh Billings

quote: I shall allow no man to belittle my soul by making me hate him.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: When angry, count to four; when very angry, swear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: There's a natural law of karma that vindictive people, who go out of their way to hurt others, will end up broke and alone.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: Whatever is begun in anger ends in shame.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Depression, suffering and anger are all part of being human.
author: Janet Fitch

quote: For me, comedy starts as a spew, a kind of explosion, and then you sculpt it from there, if at all. It comes out of a deeper, darker side. Maybe it comes from anger, because I'm outraged by cruel absurdities, the hypocrisy that exists everywhere, even within yourself, where it's hardest to see.
author: Robin Williams

quote: Yesterday, we fought wars which destroyed cities. Today, we are concerned with avoiding a war which will destroy the earth. We can adapt atomic energy to produce electricity and move ships, but can we control its use in anger?
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The opposite of anger is not calmness, its empathy.
author: Mehmet Oz

quote: I have sadness in me. I have anger in me. I have heartbreak in me.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: The ignorant mind, with its infinite afflictions, passions, and evils, is rooted in the three poisons. Greed, anger, and delusion.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: When I am angry I can pray well and preach well.
author: Martin Luther

quote: One of man's greatest obligations is anger.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: Guilt is anger directed at ourselves - at what we did or did not do. Resentment is anger directed at others - at what they did or did not do.
author: Peter McWilliams

quote: Anger is like a storm rising up from the bottom of your consciousness. When you feel it coming, turn your focus to your breath.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that four of his fingers are pointing at himself.
author: Louis Nizer

quote: Generally speaking, if a human being never shows anger, then I think something's wrong. He's not right in the brain.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: As a human being, anger is a part of our mind. Irritation also part of our mind. But you can do - anger come, go. Never keep in your sort of - your inner world, then create a lot of suspicion, a lot of distrust, a lot of negative things, more worry.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Anger is never without a reason, but seldom with a good one.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Good satire comes from anger. It comes from a sense of injustice, that there are wrongs in the world that need to be fixed. And what better place to get that well of venom and outrage boiling than a newsroom, because you're on the front lines.
author: Carl Hiaasen

quote: I think everybody should have the same anger towards the injustice that's happening and the hatred that's happening, and just fight it with love and compassion.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: Words, especially when yelled in anger, can be very damaging to a child's self-confidence. The child probably already feels bad enough just from seeing the consequences of his or her behavior. Our sons and daughters don't need more guilt and self-doubt heaped upon their already wounded egos.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: Getting angry doesn't solve anything.
author: Grace Kelly

quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
author: William Congreve

quote: When one burns one's bridges, what a very nice fire it makes.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Don't get the impression that you arouse my anger. You see, one can only be angry with those he respects.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: The flame of anger, bright and brief, sharpens the barb of love.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: I always channeled what I felt emotionally into skiing - my insecurities, my anger, my disappointment. Skiing was always my outlet, and it worked.
author: Lindsey Vonn

quote: I do stand up sometimes out of anger. Sometimes the greatest stuff comes from a dark place.
author: Tracy Morgan

quote: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

quote: You feel the shame, humiliation, and anger at being just another victim of prejudice, and at the same time, there's the nagging worry that maybe... you're just no good.
author: Nina Simone

quote: We boil at different degrees.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Get mad, then get over it.
author: Colin Powell

quote: A man that does not know how to be angry does not know how to be good.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers, for each rage leaves him less than he had been before - it takes something from him.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: There is nothing that so much gratifies an ill tongue as when it finds an angry heart.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Indulge not thyself in the passion of anger; it is whetting a sword to wound thine own breast, or murder thy friend.
author: Akhenaton

quote: As you get older, you see the world at a different angle, maybe more cynically, but I just bury my anger.
author: Zach Galifianakis

quote: Denial, panic, threats, anger - those are very human responses to feeling guilt.
author: Joshua Oppenheimer

quote: Con men look for human frailty to exploit. This is most often greed. Trump found a different vice: anger. The emotional are always the most susceptible to manipulation.
author: Pamela Meyer

quote: If you get down and quarell everyday, you're saying prayers to the devil, I say.
author: Bob Marley

quote: It seems to me that election season is just a Petri dish for anger and cynicism.
author: Max Lucado

quote: The one who cannot restrain their anger will wish undone, what their temper and irritation prompted them to do.
author: Horace

quote: Revenge is often like biting a dog because the dog bit you.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: Sometimes it's worse to win a fight than to lose.
author: Billie Holiday

quote: Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Be calm in arguing; for fierceness makes error a fault, and truth discourtesy.
author: George Herbert

quote: A broken bone can heal, but the wound a word opens can fester forever.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Behind every argument is someone's ignorance.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: There was never an angry man that thought his anger unjust.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Reacting in anger or annoyance will not advance one's ability to persuade.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: I did not want to put myself on the line, as an Australian playing Britain's greatest comic actor. The fans of Sellers are obsessive, possessive - and aggressive. I did not want to risk their anger - or my own reputation.
author: Geoffrey Rush

quote: Anger is a manifestation of a deeper issue... and that, for me, is based on insecurity, self-esteem and loneliness.
author: Naomi Campbell

quote: I've always turned my anger inwards towards self-destruction.
author: Mackenzie Phillips

quote: I'm generally slow to anger, quick to forgive, and I take in information before making decisions. So no matter how controversial the decision, my general demeanour is to put on white lab coat and gloves and look at the evidence, weigh the arguments and see what makes sense.
author: Peter Blair Henry

quote: When you hold on to anger and unforgiveness, you can't move forward.
author: Mary J. Blige

quote: Sometimes the routes leading to feelings of anger are so convoluted and circuitous that it takes enormous skill to discern their original source, or fountainhead. But regardless of the reason for or the source of the anger or the relative ease or complexity in perceiving either the anger or its source - everybody, but everybody, gets angry.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: President Obama and members of his administration constantly express rage and anger over events totally within their control. It's an odd and unsettling fact of American life that so many Americans seem to think that such expressions of frustration should substitute for actual competence.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: Vengeance is the act of turning anger in on yourself. On the surface it may be directed at someone else, but it is a surefire recipe for arresting emotional recovery.
author: Jane Goldman

quote: Each person's drive to overwork is unique, and doing too much numbs every workaholic's emotions differently. Sometimes overwork numbs depression, sometimes anger, sometimes envy, sometimes sexuality. Or the overworker runs herself ragged in a race for attention.
author: Arlie Russell Hochschild

quote: I don't feel bitterness, I don't feel anger towards anybody. Fighting is never emotional to me.
author: Conor McGregor

quote: I'm very much inspired by things that anger me. If I see bigotry, stupidity, or injustice on the news, I'm inspired to find a way to make it into something comedic and relatable. Anger inspires me. Stupidity inspires me. My family inspires me. My accountant inspires me. Everything and anything, really.
author: Maysoon Zayid

quote: Violent anger makes me physically ill.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: My songs have always been frustrating themes, relationships that I've had. And now that I'm in love, I expect it to be really happy, or at least there won't be half as much anger as there was.
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: The ego mind both professes its desire for love and does everything possible to repel it, or if it gets here anyway, to sabotage it. That is why dealing with issues like control, anger, and neediness is the most important work in preparing ourselves for love.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: In plain terms, a child is a complicated creature who can drive you crazy. There's a cruelty to childhood, there's an anger.
author: Maurice Sendak

quote: I think my passion is misinterpreted as anger sometimes. And I don't think people are ready for the message that I'm delivering, and delivering with a sense of violent love.
author: Charlie Sheen

quote: The spiritual message is we lose our lives in pleasing others; if you're the good child who pleases Mommy and Daddy but internalizes anger, you're setting yourself up for disease.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: Anger is an unnecessary emotion. Loads of stuff in life can trigger it, but what matters is how you react. I choose not to react.
author: Nicola Adams

quote: Anger is just not who I am, and I don't think it's what voters in the 6th district want. They want respectful, decent representation that contrasts so starkly with what we have in Washington.
author: Jon Ossoff

quote: It's important to remember that the animals are not grieving with us. They're very accepting. They're not lying there thinking 'How could you do this to me? Why aren't you keeping me going?' Pets don't do the human things of guilt and anger and recrimination that we do. They come and go with great acceptance.
author: Jon Katz

quote: Let there be a door to thy mouth, that it may be shut when need arises, and let it be carefully barred, that none may rouse thy voice to anger, and thou pay back abuse with abuse.
author: Saint Ambrose

quote: My anger with the US was not at first, that they had used that weapon - although that anger came later.
author: Wilfred Burchett

quote: I want to express myself to feel that what I feel is real. My joy, my pain, my anger.
author: Annabella Sciorra

quote: I started writing because there's an absence of things I was familiar with or that I dreamed about. One of my senses of anger is related to this vacancy - a yearning I had as a teenager... and when I get ready to write, I think I'm trying to fill that.
author: Ntozake Shange

quote: People are fed up with the way things are. There is a lot of bitterness out there, a lot of anger about a lack of jobs and concerns for the next generation.
author: Gary Lineker
